description:
Let’s face it, a company whose mission is human transformation better have some fresh thinking about the employer/employee relationship.

We do. We can’t cram it all in here, but you’ll start noticing it from the first interview.

Even our candidate experience is different. And when you get an offer from us (and accept it), you get way more than a paycheck. You get a personal BetterUp Coach, a development plan, a trained and coached manager, the most amazing team you’ve ever met (yes, each with their own personal BetterUp Coach), and most importantly, work that matters.

This makes for a remarkably focused and fulfilling work experience. Frankly, it’s not for everyone. But for people with fire in their belly, it’s a game-changing, career-defining, soul-lifting move.

Join us and we promise you the most intense and fulfilling years of your career, doing life-changing work in a fun, inventive, soulful culture.

If that sounds exciting—and the job description below feels like a fit—we really should start talking.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Data Analyst to join our team. At BetterUp we believe that data is critical to our success. If you are passionate about helping people reach their potential, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you get to build the future, and enjoy driving the business forward with data, then this is the role for you.

What You’ll Do


 * Work with our Product squads to develop (and productize) the measurement strategy, data, and visualizations to communicate BetterUp’s value to our customers
 * Partner closely with engineering, providing guidance on instrumentation design for new features and creating new datasets that delight our business users.
 * Own the product-related Explores and dashboards in Looker, ensuring the continued accuracy of the data and building new dimensions/measures as they are needed.
 * Partner with the Product team to identify internal KPIs, build standardized reporting to monitor product ecosystem health, and contribute to business reviews.
 * Conduct data deep dives to better understand drivers of business performance and proactively identify new areas of opportunity and risk. Present results and recommendations to cross-functional partners and the Executive Team.
 * Evangelize the strategic use of analytics, educating business partners on how to self serve and interpret data, and working with them to translate insights into action.
 * Play an integral role in helping define the analytics function at BetterUp.
 * Report to the Director of Product Analytics and be fully embedded in a product squad.
   
   

If you have some or all of the following, please apply:


 * 5+ years of experience building custom reporting, insights, and analytics products; experience with Customer Analytics Platforms preferred
 * Strong proficiency in SQL, Looker/Tableau, and Amplitude (Python / R a plus)
 * Experience working with text / unstructured data, sentiment / theme analysis, and / or Generative AI and LLM-powered applications preferred
 * Exceptional written and oral communication skills, with the ability to translate complex results into clear strategic recommendations
 * A self-starter that can jump right in and quickly add value
 * A demonstrated ability to think like an owner and make effective prioritization decisions in a dynamic environment
 * A strong desire to be a builder of something new
   
   

Benefits

At BetterUp, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community.


 * Access to BetterUp coaching; one for you and one for a friend or family member
 * A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
 * Medical, dental, and vision insurance
 * Flexible paid time off
 * Per year:
    * All federal/statutory holidays observed
    * 4 BetterUp Inner Workdays (https://www.betterup.co/inner-work)
    * 5 Volunteer Days to give back
    * Learning and Development stipend
    * Company wide Summer & Winter breaks

 * Year-round charitable contribution of your choice on behalf of BetterUp
 * 401(k) self contribution
   

We are dedicated to building diverse teams that fuel an authentic workplace and sense of belonging for each and every employee. We know applying for a job can be intimidating, please don’t hesitate to reach out — we encourage everyone interested in joining us to apply.

BetterUp Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, BetterUp Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

At BetterUp, we compensate our employees fairly for their work. Base salary is determined by job-related experience, education/training, residence location, as well as market indicators. The range below is representative of base salary only and does not include equity, sales bonus plans (when applicable) and benefits. This range may be modified in the future.

The base salary range for this role is $130,000 – $223,000.

If you live in New York, the base salary range for this role is:

$149,000 – $223,000 : New York City

$130,000 – $194,000 : Nassau, Newburgh

We value your privacy. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy. If you have any questions about the privacy of your personal data or your rights with regards to your personal data, please reach out to support@betterup.co
title: Senior Product Data Analyst

description:
As a Senior Data Analyst on the Point of Care (POC) Analytics Team, you will design, build, and deploy analytical solutions using a variety of tools, providing actionable business intelligence to POC leadership and other stakeholders at IDEXX. You will deliver data-driven recommendations, strategic insights, and intuitive dashboards and reports that support business growth, operational planning, and strategic initiatives.

This is a hybrid role with two days per week on-site at the Westbrook, ME campus.

You will be part of a full-service analytics team that develops robust data pipelines, curates data sets, and delivers operational reporting and dynamic dashboards to inform critical business decisions. This high-visibility role will require partnering with global stakeholders, including POC product management teams, sales, marketing, finance, customer support, and supply chain, to drive performance, enhance customer outcomes, and meet IDEXX’s strategic goals.

In This Role You Will


 * Partner with senior stakeholders in product management to deliver high-impact reporting, analysis, and recommendations.
 * Develop knowledge of IDEXX data systems and processes, provide recommendations for improvement, and maintain written documentation related to data analysis.
 * Design, implement, and deliver standard and ad hoc reports to support data-driven analysis and decision-making for multiple initiatives, projects, and programs.
 * Perform data analyses using appropriate statistical methods and graphical display standards to uncover insights.
 * Present reports and data insights to internal customers, providing actionable recommendations to business partners.
 * Develop, enhance, and maintain high-quality reporting systems and dashboards that generate reliable, repeatable, and trusted results.
 * Actively seek opportunities for continuous learning and professional development to enhance your skills and contribute effectively to the POC analytics team.
   
   

What do you need to succeed?


 * Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
 * Experience in working with ‘big’ datasets and producing descriptive and predictive analyses.
 * Experience in visualizing business insights in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, QuickSight or similar.
 * Experience working with relational databases such as Snowflake, Oracle PostgreSQL, Redshift etc.
 * Strong communication skills, both verbal and written and can translate technical subject matter to non-technical audiences (both as a speaker and listener).
 * Understanding of various database structures and command methods in data transformation, cleansing, and validation.
   
   

What you can expect from us:


 * Salary of $100,000-$120,000
 * Opportunity for annual cash bonus
 * Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One
 * 5% matching 401k
 * Additional benefits including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more
   
   

Why IDEXX

We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. As an innovation expert in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Core Values to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, ensure safe drinking water for billions, and help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and over 10,000 talented employees globally.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be motivated by generous compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Let’s Pursue What Matters Together.

IDEXX values diversity and encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ persons, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

IDEXX is an equal-opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.
sector: Biotechnology Research, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Veterinary Services
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Level: Intermediate

Work Hours: 40 per week

Rate/Salary: $60/hour W2 (no benefits) or $102,600 annually plus benefits




Scope of Work/Job Characteristics

The Reports Developer will serve as the principal line of communication for the project team. Responsibilities include:

 * Developing and overseeing BI tools with a comprehensive understanding of the BI system.
 * Transforming substantial volumes of transactional and historical data into actionable insights through user-friendly, interactive dashboards and reports.
 * Designing and implementing scalable solutions to address evolving business needs in the IT landscape.
 * Collaborating with business users to understand data needs, translating them into technical specifications, and prioritizing reporting requirements.
 * Extracting, transforming, and loading data from various sources (File servers, RDBMS, APIs) into Power BI data models, utilizing DAX to create meaningful metrics and KPIs.
 * Designing visually appealing dashboards and reports with intuitive navigation.
 * Ensuring clear data presentation at both the summary and detailed levels.
 * Presenting findings and recommendations through reports, presentations, and other communication channels.
 * Performing data quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency of data.
 * Optimizing reports for fast loading times and scalability to handle large datasets.
 * Training end-users on application navigation and interpreting reports effectively.
 * Maintaining comprehensive documentation of data models, business logic, and user guides.

Note: This position may require reporting for duty during emergencies or potential emergencies.




Work Environment

Location: On-site work is required.

Required Qualifications

 * A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.
 * A minimum of three years of IT experience in business intelligence tools and systems.
 * Proficiency in BI features, including data modeling, DAX calculations, visualizations, and report design.
 * Strong SQL querying skills.
 * Ability to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and interpret data for actionable insights.
 * Proven problem-solving skills with a systematic approach.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

 * Expertise in BI technologies (e.g., Microsoft Power BI – PL 300, Oracle BI, Certified Business Intelligence Professional).
 * Experience executing DAX queries on the Power BI desktop.

Additional Requirement: Candidates must pass a Level II Background Check.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




 * This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
 * You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
 * You can work on your own schedule
 * Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




 * Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
 * Write high-quality answers and code snippets
 * Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




 * Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
 * Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
 * Excellent writing and grammar skills
 * A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
 * Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

title: Data Analyst

description:
As a member of the company's Capacity Planning team, the Data Center Capacity Analyst will play a central role in helping the Company to achieve key objectives related to the Data Center Intelligence program. The Analyst will collaborate with Product, Sales Engineering, and General Management to develop and maintain reporting for a dynamic set of ongoing initiatives. A proactive self-starter, the Analyst will identify opportunities for process improvements, work cross-functionally with teams across departments, and drive these initiatives to successful completion.

Duties:

Inventory Management and Reporting

 * Maintain ownership of accurate space and power inventory records using inventory management software
 * Standardize and update floor planning drawings, electrical, and mechanical schematics using inventory management software such as AutoCAD and Revit
 * Prepare and analyze capacity and inventory dashboard reports to support decision-making for Product, Sales Engineering, and General Management teams
 * Identify and address capacity constraints, including highly utilized electrical equipment, by researching mitigation strategies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement solutions

Business Process Improvement

 * Collaborate with organizational leaders to establish operational objectives and monitor performance
 * Drive process improvements to enhance data accuracy, streamline workflows, and expedite information delivery
 * Analyze data to identify opportunities for optimization and present actionable recommendations to improve operations

Data Analysis and Insights

 * Conduct research and analysis on space and power inventory to support Sales and Data Center Operations
 * Analyze trends in customer metrics, order management, and capacity utilization to identify trends and inform business decisions
 * Create tailored reports and deliver data-driven insights to address evolving organizational needs

Stakeholder Communication

 * Present analysis results and recommendations to cross-functional teams to ensure recommendations drive and operational improvements
 * Support internal teams with strategic, data-driven recommendations to optimize operations and meet business goals
   
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Ability to thrive in a hybrid work environment that includes at least two onsite days per week in the downtown Denver office, currently Tuesdays and Wednesdays for in-person collaboration
 * Project-based travel approximately once per quarter, with flexibility to adapt to evolving business and project needs
 * Proficiency in AutoCAD and Revit for creating, updating, and managing technical drawings
 * Experience with inventory management software and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to support reporting and analysis
 * Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with a systematic approach to interpretating and leveraging data
 * Excellent communication skills, including the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to stakeholders across all levels of the organization
 * Familiarity with data center operations or space and power inventory management is preferred
 * Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in technical drawings, reports, and dashboards.
 * Solid finance or business operations background with a proven track record of implementing systematic automation and driving operational efficiency.

Education/Experience:

 * Bachelor's degree in finance, business, engineering, or a related field preferred, or equivalent professional experience
 * Coursework or background in engineering is a plus
 * 3-5 years of relevant work experience in data analysis, capacity planning, or a similar field, with experience in data center infrastructure or IT capacity planning strongly preferred

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to handle or feel objects; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop or kneel; talk and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Compensation:

Compensation for this role includes a base salary between $90,000 and $110,000 annually. This role is also eligible for an annual bonus and equity, based upon individual and company performance.

Posting Timeline: This position is expected to be open for applications through January 20, 2025.



Benefits



Not only does CoreSite have a fun, team-focused work environment, but we also offer great benefits to all employees regularly scheduled to work more than 20 hours a week!

 * First-day medical insurance through Cigna with generous premium cost coverage
 * Dental insurance through Delta Dental
 * Vision insurance through VSP
 * Telemedicine through MDLive for Cigna
 * Healthcare and dependent care flexible spending account (FSA) plans
 * Health saving account (HSA) plans for employees participating in the High Deductible Health Plan
 * Life, AD&D, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance fully paid by the company
 * Voluntary coverage benefits for supplemental life, critical illness, accident, and hospital insurance
 * First-day eligibility for 401(k) savings plan through Fidelity, which includes an attractive matching company contribution
 * Discretionary annual bonus and equity incentive plan
 * Employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) with a 15 percent discount
 * 16 days of paid time off (PTO)
 * 11 paid company holidays and additional floating holidays
 * School visitation and elder care paid time off
 * Parental leave, adoption and surrogacy benefits, and family planning/fertility support
 * Wellness reimbursement program & wellness incentive program
 * Free parking or a company contribution toward a public transit pass
 * Education reimbursement and student loan debt assistance program
 * Employee assistance program, childcare resources, personal finance management support, and student loan debt assistance program
 * Pet insurance
 * Charitable matching program

Applicant Privacy Notice: CoreSite is committed to protecting the privacy and security of personal information submitted by applicants. The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) requires us to provide you information about our personal information handling practices. As a result, we're providing this Privacy Notice that describes how we collect, use, share, and update personal information from individuals who wish to be considered for employment with CoreSite. To read the Applicant Privacy Notice, please go to https://www.coresite.com/applicant-privacy-notice

description:
Job Description




We have a 6-month contract-to-hire position open for a Data Analyst. The data analyst needs to have a strong background with SQL, Excel, Data Management, SAS, Teradata, Snowflake, and Python.




The position is remote, but the candidate must sit in CA. Preferably Sacramento or Los Angeles.



day to day responsibilities):

 * Data Collection and preparation
 * Extracting data from claims, enrollment, encounter, and payment systems
 * Cleaning and transforming raw data to ensure accuracy and usability
 * Integrating data from multiple source

Claims and Encounter Analytics

Monitoring encounter data for patterns in operational inefficiencies and risk adjustment value

Analyzing encounter data to ensure compliance with state and federal guidelines

Measuring provider performance based on metrics like utilization, timeliness, reject rate, and quality of care

Reporting and Visualization

Building dashboards and reports for leadership and stakeholders using Power BI (e.g. Claims trends, patient outcomes, operational efficiency)

Presenting actionable insights to drive strategy or policy division

Ensuring reports align with regulatory requirements

Direct Payment Compliance and Liability Assessments

Provide reconciliation reporting to stakeholders and payment recipients

Prepare data submissions for regulatory agencies (DHCS)

Ensure encounter and claims data meet reporting deadlines and quality thresholds

Staying updated on policy changes and understanding their impact on programs

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Working with IT to optimize data pipelines and systems

Partnering with Provider Engagement teams to evaluate the effectiveness of reporting

Identifying Opportunities for Improvement

Analyzing member and provider data to identify gaps in care or submission quality

Recommending operational improvements based on data-driven insights

Testing and validating new analytics tools or methods

Ad Hoc Analysis

Answering data requests from stakeholders within organization

Investigating anomalies in encounter submissions and escalating or resolving discrepancies

Staying Up-to-Date

Keeping current with industry trends, new tools, and best practices in healthcare analytics

Learning about legislative changes that impact health insurance analytics

 * 

Describe the performance expectations/metrics for this individual and their team:

 * Report deliveries and identified project milestones being reached

Tell me about what their first day looks like:

 * Acclimating to the team, data structures, and existing reporting

What previous job titles or background work will in this role?

 * Data Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, Healthcare Analyst

Any future projected positions potentially coming up? NO If yes, note:

Internal/External Groups with which the Candidate will interface:



Required Skills/Experience:

1.

Strong SQL Skills

2.

Extract, Transform, Load data from multiple data sources

3.

Data Management

4.

COLLABORATIVE, INTERPERSONAL, ORAL, AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION

5.

ABILITY TO WORK WELL WITH MULTIPLE INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS, AS WELL AS WORK INDEPENDENTLY




Preferred Skills/ Experience:

1.

SAS ENTERPRISE GUIDE

2.

TERADATA, ORACLE, SNOWFLAKE SQL

3.

PYTHON (DATA WRANGLING & MANAGEMENT)

4.

ABILITY TO CREATE TECHNICAL AND BUSINESS PROCESS WORKFLOW DIAGRAMS



Education Requirement:

Bachelor in math, statistics, information systems, computer science, or related field.

Education Preferred:

Master in math, statistics, information systems, computer science, or related field.

Software Skills Required:

SQL, Excel, Python

None

description:
Let’s face it, a company whose mission is human transformation better have some fresh thinking about the employer/employee relationship.

We do. We can’t cram it all in here, but you’ll start noticing it from the first interview.

Even our candidate experience is different. And when you get an offer from us (and accept it), you get way more than a paycheck. You get a personal BetterUp Coach, a development plan, a trained and coached manager, the most amazing team you’ve ever met (yes, each with their own personal BetterUp Coach), and most importantly, work that matters.

This makes for a remarkably focused and fulfilling work experience. Frankly, it’s not for everyone. But for people with fire in their belly, it’s a game-changing, career-defining, soul-lifting move.

Join us and we promise you the most intense and fulfilling years of your career, doing life-changing work in a fun, inventive, soulful culture.

If that sounds exciting—and the job description below feels like a fit—we really should start talking.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Data Analyst to join our team. At BetterUp we believe that data is critical to our success. If you are passionate about helping people reach their potential, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you get to build the future, and enjoy driving the business forward with data, then this is the role for you.

What You’ll Do


 * Work with our Product squads to develop (and productize) the measurement strategy, data, and visualizations to communicate BetterUp’s value to our customers
 * Partner closely with engineering, providing guidance on instrumentation design for new features and creating new datasets that delight our business users.
 * Own the product-related Explores and dashboards in Looker, ensuring the continued accuracy of the data and building new dimensions/measures as they are needed.
 * Partner with the Product team to identify internal KPIs, build standardized reporting to monitor product ecosystem health, and contribute to business reviews.
 * Conduct data deep dives to better understand drivers of business performance and proactively identify new areas of opportunity and risk. Present results and recommendations to cross-functional partners and the Executive Team.
 * Evangelize the strategic use of analytics, educating business partners on how to self serve and interpret data, and working with them to translate insights into action.
 * Play an integral role in helping define the analytics function at BetterUp.
 * Report to the Director of Product Analytics and be fully embedded in a product squad.
   
   

If you have some or all of the following, please apply:


 * 5+ years of experience building custom reporting, insights, and analytics products; experience with Customer Analytics Platforms preferred
 * Strong proficiency in SQL, Looker/Tableau, and Amplitude (Python / R a plus)
 * Experience working with text / unstructured data, sentiment / theme analysis, and / or Generative AI and LLM-powered applications preferred
 * Exceptional written and oral communication skills, with the ability to translate complex results into clear strategic recommendations
 * A self-starter that can jump right in and quickly add value
 * A demonstrated ability to think like an owner and make effective prioritization decisions in a dynamic environment
 * A strong desire to be a builder of something new
   
   

Benefits

At BetterUp, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community.


 * Access to BetterUp coaching; one for you and one for a friend or family member
 * A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
 * Medical, dental, and vision insurance
 * Flexible paid time off
 * Per year:
    * All federal/statutory holidays observed
    * 4 BetterUp Inner Workdays (https://www.betterup.co/inner-work)
    * 5 Volunteer Days to give back
    * Learning and Development stipend
    * Company wide Summer & Winter breaks

 * Year-round charitable contribution of your choice on behalf of BetterUp
 * 401(k) self contribution
   

We are dedicated to building diverse teams that fuel an authentic workplace and sense of belonging for each and every employee. We know applying for a job can be intimidating, please don’t hesitate to reach out — we encourage everyone interested in joining us to apply.

BetterUp Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, BetterUp Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

At BetterUp, we compensate our employees fairly for their work. Base salary is determined by job-related experience, education/training, residence location, as well as market indicators. The range below is representative of base salary only and does not include equity, sales bonus plans (when applicable) and benefits. This range may be modified in the future.

The base salary range for this role is $130,000 – $223,000.

If you live in New York, the base salary range for this role is:

$149,000 – $223,000 : New York City

$130,000 – $194,000 : Nassau, Newburgh

description:
Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and visualization to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work closely with various departments to understand their data needs and help them achieve their goals through effective reporting and analysis.

While your scope will cover multiple business units, your focus will be on insights for our Sales Organization. Previous experience in Sales Operations roles could be useful.

Duties

 * Build and maintain reporting to drive business insights including market analysis, future product opportunities, key customer data, etc.
 * Develop and maintain interactive dashboards using tools such as Power BI and Tableau to visualize key performance indicators.
 * Conduct thorough business analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications for database design.
 * Utilize SQL for querying databases and extracting relevant data for analysis.
 * Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and advanced analytics tasks.
 * Manage projects effectively, ensuring timely delivery of insights and reports.
 * Present findings and recommendations to management in a clear and concise manner.

Requirements

 * Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and Python is essential.
 * Strong understanding of database design principles.
 * Experience with business analysis methodologies and project management practices.
 * Ability to analyze complex datasets and vaticinate future trends based on historical data.
 * Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
 * A proactive approach to problem-solving with a strong attention to detail.
 * Previous experience in a similar role is a plus but not mandatory.

Join us in harnessing the power of data to drive strategic decisions!

About EZ Solar Products:

EZ Solar Products' mission is to make solar simple with innovative products that are high-quality, installer-friendly, and cost-effective. With a solution for any install, EZ Solar junction boxes and wire management solutions are built to last for life and come with a 25-year warranty. With an incredible team and tons of growth, this is an opportunity to join a company that's changing the industry and making a difference for the planet.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
McLane Intelligent Solutions is seeking a skilled Power BI Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying impactful business intelligence solutions using Power BI. In this role, you will collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and create dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights for data-driven decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Develop and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, and analysis solutions that effectively communicate business insights
 * Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business units to collect, organize, and analyze data from various sources
 * Design data models and establish relationships between data sources to optimize report performance
 * Implement data transformation processes using Power Query and DAX for effective data analysis
 * Monitor and optimize Power BI report performance and manage user access and security settings
 * Provide training and support to users to encourage effective use of Power BI tools and resources
 * Stay informed on the latest Power BI features and best practices to continuously improve reporting capabilities
 * Collaborate with the IT team to ensure seamless integration of Power BI with other data platforms and applications
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
 * Proven experience as a Power BI Developer or similar role focused on business intelligence solutions
 * Strong proficiency in Microsoft Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and data modeling
 * Experience with data visualization best practices and dashboard design
 * Experience with Microsoft D365 F&O or AX2012, Azure Synapse, Logic apps, Microsoft Fabric is a must
 * Familiarity with SQL and experience in querying databases (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, etc.)
 * Ability to analyze complex datasets and present insights in a clear and visually appealing manner
 * Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders
 * Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes is a plus
 * Familiarity with cloud platforms, such as Azure, is desirable
 * Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
   
   
   

Benefits


 * Competitive base salary
 * Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off
 * Ongoing training and professional development opportunities

description:
Open to remote work except in South Dakota, Vermont and West Virginia.



The annual base salary for this position ranges from $99,500.00 in our lowest geographic market to $222,900.00 in our highest geographic market. Actual salary will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.



Information About Benefits Can Be Found Here.



Who We Are Looking For



Converse is the story of a sneaker that started on the court and moved to the stage and the streets. We’re a company ready for change and that’s who we hire: the most malleable, the most innovative, and the most creative. Our clothes and sneakers have been worn by rebels, rockers, rappers, artists, thinkers, and individuals. So that’s why we hire individuals.



Converse is looking for a seasoned Digital Media and Marketing Analytics Professional with expertise in ROI Measurement (MTA / MMM), Campaign Test & Learn, Audience Selection and Segmentation, DMP / CDP and web platform measurement. We want someone who can be a player/coach in our Marketing Analytics function collaborating with our global and geography partners.



What You Will Work On





 * Partner with internal stakeholders & decision-makers to evaluate business objectives, and propose analytical data solutions that deliver meaningful insights
 * Utilizing data sources to understand our customers purchasing patterns, with the goal of providing insights to inform new marketing strategies
 * Manage the relationship with tech partners and act as primary point of connect when recommending new use-cases
 * Serve as primary CDP lead, onboarding new users to the tool and providing regular platform maintenance
 * Develop and perform quality checks on data for both ad hoc and ongoing processes.
   
   



Qualifications





 * 5+ years of experience in data analytics, digital marketing and/or mar-tech platforms leveraging data and insights to drive recommendations preferred
 * Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technology or, Marketing, Business or Economics
 * Strong understanding of CDP and DMP platforms (Segment, Tealium Audience Stream, Adobe Audience Manager, etc.)
 * Passion and experience with data-based decision-making processes, with a strong emphasis on marketing performance analytics & optimization
 * Expertise with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and tag management tools
 * Understanding of how to use digital media, performance marketing and emerging channels such as paid search (Google ads), paid social (Facebook, Instagram ads), email, affiliates etc. to drive customer acquisition and retention
 * Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
 * Experience in SQL
 * Positive demeanor and willingness to learn new things
 * Experience in SQL
   
   



We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Job Description

Position Title: Data Analyst

Reports to: Chief Community Investment Officer

Classification: Exempt

WRK Group Overview

REACH serves as the community quarterback for comprehensive community revitalization in the Riverside neighborhood, located in northeast Wilmington, DE.  REACH supports and leverages efforts and resources which promote upward economic mobility for Riverside residents. Employing the Purpose-Built Communities’ model, the revitalization focuses on three pillars: 1) redevelopment including high-quality, mixed-income housing, 2) a cradle to college and career readiness pipeline, and 3) community health, wellness, and safety initiatives. REACH, in collaboration with service partners Kingswood Community Center and The Warehouse (an innovative teen center with more than 150 partner organizations) work together to transform Riverside into a robust, healthy, and vibrant community. The Warehouse, REACH Riverside and Kingswood Community Center are collectively known as the "WRK Group".

Position Summary

This position is responsible for collecting and interpreting data to help the organization take actionable steps to improve performance and meet goals This includes gathering information and statistics, building charts and graphs to present results to leadership and finding ways to improve organizational efficiencies using gathered data.

Essential Functions

Data Collection and Preparation


 * Collect, interpret, and analyze data using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
 * Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
 * Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
   
   

Data Analysis and Interpretation


 * Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
 * Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems.
 * Use statistical techniques to generate insights and answer business questions.
   
   

Reporting and Visualization


 * Create clear, concise, and visually appealing reports, dashboards, and presentations.
 * Use tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to communicate findings effectively.
   
   

Collaboration with Stakeholders


 * Work with business teams to understand their data needs and objectives.
 * Translate business requirements into analytical tasks and deliver actionable insights.
   
   

Performance Monitoring and Optimization


 * Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics.
 * Provide recommendations for process improvements and strategic decisions based on data insights.
   
   

Data Governance and Compliance


 * Maintain compliance with policies, procedures, and regulations governing state/federal contracts and other funders.
   
   

Predictive Modeling and Forecasting


 * Create presentations and reports using graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data.
 * Develop predictive models and forecasts to support future planning.
 * Use machine learning algorithms for advanced analytics, if required.
   
   

Ad Hoc Analysis


 * Identify and define new opportunities for data improvement.
 * Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
 * Work directly with leadership, managers, and partners to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
   
   

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Skills And Abilities

The incumbent must be able to:


 * Proficiently utilize Microsoft Office suite, database management and graphics applications (i.e., Adobe, Photoshop, Publisher, and CRM software.)
 * Demonstrate strong analytical skill with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate substantial amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Be adept at queries, report writing with the ability to present findings in a compelling and easy to understand manner.
 * Self-start a project or a task, with a high level of initiative, and be a proven proactive thinker who thrives in a dynamic and matrixed environment.
 * Exercise initiative and sound judgment in analyzing complex issues and problems, identify, and evaluate alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions, and implement recommendations in support of goals.
 * Express ideas, concepts, and technical information clearly and concisely, both in writing and orally.
 * Manage multiple projects with a strong attention to detail and have organization and effective time management skills.
 * Analyze complex issues and problems, identify, and evaluate alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions, and implement recommendations in support of goals.
 * Work with shared leadership and in cross-functional teams.
 * Operate as a team player.
 * Adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility as workstreams shift.
 * Maintain confidentiality.
   
   

Education And Experience 


 * BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
 * At least 3 years working as a Data Analyst with demonstrated experience with data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
 * Proficiency in statistics and experience using statistical software for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
   
   

Supervisory Responsibility

None

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work 

This is a full-time position with varying hours of work: Monday through Friday, 8:30 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require after-hours and weekend work.

Travel

Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Conditions of Hire


 * A satisfactory criminal background, education verification and reference check.
 * Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
   
   

Failure to meet these requirements may result in an employment offer being withdrawn. 

Physical Tasks And Working Conditions


 * Office and classroom work requires sitting for extended periods of time.
 * Using a computer, keyboard, and screen, as well as teaching tools (whiteboard, projector, etc.)
 * Must be able to move about to facilitate workshops, access files, operate equipment and office machinery.
 * Must be able to withstand different environmental conditions, including outdoor conditions, extreme heat and/or cold, and loud noise level.
 * Must have the ability to focus while working under environmental conditions.
 * Must have full use of peripheral vision, distance vision, and depth perception.
 * Must have mobility, vision, hearing, and dexterity levels appropriate to the duties to be performed.
   
   

The physical demands described in the job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Equipment Use

Telephone, copier/scanner, computer/laptop (Microsoft Office Applications), tablet and fax machine.

Mental Demands

Solve problems, make decisions, exercise sound judgment, interpret data, organize, write, plan, prioritize, communicate clearly, de-escalate situations, model respectful non-abusive behavior, critical thinking, critical reasoning, attention to detail, ability to recall, coordinate schedules, work as a member of a team, and speak in public.

Evaluation of Performance

Performance in this position will be evaluated in accordance with the Employee Handbook.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Warehouse is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age, veteran status, or any other status protected under local, state, or federal laws.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Concord isn't your typical consulting firm; we are an execution company with a passion for making things happen. Our mission is to help clients enhance customer experiences, optimize operations, and revolutionize their product offerings through seamless integration, optimization, and activation of technology and data.




This role is for a highly skilled BI Analyst with Cognos Analytics expertise who will play a key role in our data-driven decision-making. You'll be responsible for the entire data journey, from building data pipelines and data models to creating insightful reports and dashboards using Cognos, with a focus on financial data and operational metrics.




What you will be doing

 * Design and develop robust SQL queries to extract and transform data for reporting and visualization.
 * Create sophisticated reports and dashboards in Cognos Analytics, ensuring clarity and alignment with client objectives.
 * Build and maintain data architecture, ensuring optimal performance of queries, pipelines, and automation workflows.
 * Analyze data quality and identify discrepancies between available data and reporting needs, providing actionable insights for stakeholders.
 * Develop and implement data transformation processes (ETL) using tools like Databricks or Alteryx.
 * Leverage cloud-based data solutions like AWS, Snowflake, Azure, or Google Cloud to support scalable and efficient data management.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to design and execute data strategies, with a focus on financial metrics and operational analytics.




What we are looking for

 * Extensive experience with Cognos Analytics including report building, dashboard design, and optimization for performance.
 * Finance experience preferred, including familiarity with financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting processes.
 * Advanced SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries and optimize performance.
 * Proven experience developing and implementing ETL pipelines using tools like Databricks and/or Alteryx.
 * Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions such as AWS, Snowflake, Azure, or Google Cloud.
 * Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python) to automate data processes is a plus.
 * Experience with relational database systems (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or MySQL).




Job specifications

 * Employment type: full-time employment with Concord.
 * Work arrangement: hybrid-flex (1-2 days on-site, but flexible). Open to remote candidates based outside of KC.
 * Office location: Parkville, MO.
 * Interview process: (1) introductory call, (2) take-home assessment, and (3) panel interview with the hiring team.
 * Requirements: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship, now or in the future.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Cognos Analytics

description:
What Data Analytics brings to Cardinal Health:

Data Analytics is responsible for applying business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant, and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives. Support Medical supply chain and logistics businesses by developing, managing, and maintaining data-driven tools and actionable insights.



ResponsibilitiesThe role will work across the supply chain with different levels of the organization, gathering data and analytics requirements, driving data acquisition, ingestion & curation to deliver trusted actionable results in a clear and concise manner.

 * The role will also manage existing tools, such as scorecards and dashboards, and look for ways to enhance or improve upon speed, process flow, functionality, and overall value.
 * Uses knowledge of business and data to discover and/or anticipate problems or opportunities where data can be leveraged to address the need.
 * Asks probing questions to translate business needs in order to build and design reporting solutions (metric management, dashboards, enterprise performance management).
 * Applies data visualization, descriptive and summary statistical techniques for discovery and timely insights (data exploration, ad-hoc queries, and analysis).
 * Interprets results of analyses, identifies trends and issues (forecasting), and develops alternatives to support business objectives.
 * Applies data aggregation, descriptive analysis and data presentation techniques and tools to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action.
 * Demonstrates ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex information to a variety of audiences and mediums.
 * Prioritizes and organizes tasks to deliver on time
 * Clearly articulates progress updates, highlights risks with mitigation plans early and manages issues effectively



Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalent work experience, preferred
 * 4-8 years of experience, preferred
 * Experience with data query, visualization, dashboard and/or scorecard tools preferredAbility to collect, synthesize, and interpret information from multiple sources as well as provide easy to understand recommendations
 * Strong mathematical and statistical skills
 * Prefer experience in Data Movement and Processing Technologies and Cloud Data Warehouse technologies including but not limited to experience with GCP, Big Query, Google Cloud Storage, Apache Spark
 * Strong knowledge and experience with Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, SAP, GCP/Big Query, and Python/R is preferred.
 * Distribution/Supply Chain experience a plus
 * Ability to travel up to 10% of the time domestically



What is expected of you and others at this level

 * Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
 * May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
 * Works on complex projects of large scope
 * Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
 * Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
 * Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
 * May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues



Anticipated salary range: $79,700 - $113,800

Bonus eligible: No

Benefits: Cardinal Health offers a wide variety of benefits and programs to support health and well-being.

 * Medical, dental and vision coverage
 * Paid time off plan
 * Health savings account (HSA)
 * 401k savings plan
 * Access to wages before pay day with myFlexPay
 * Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
 * Short- and long-term disability coverage
 * Work-Life resources
 * Paid parental leave
 * Healthy lifestyle programs

Application window anticipated to close: 1/20/2025 *if interested in opportunity, please submit application as soon as possible.

The salary range listed is an estimate. Pay at Cardinal Health is determined by multiple factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographical location, relevant education, experience and skills and an evaluation of internal pay equity.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.



Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

description:
Posting Description

SENIOR DATA ANALYST, MIT Energy Initiative , to serve as key advisor to the Institute for Innovation Fellow (IIF) to lead research, analysis, and develop data tools on economic and climate policy topics, including competition, tax policy, clean energy, sustainability, and industrial/manufacturing policy; build and maintain the GCIM database by compiling and analyzing data on global clean energy subsidies; collaborate with MIT CEEPR and the Rhodium Group to produce and update original research for the GCIM; design and build data architecture, pipelines, and products to address policy data problems; support drafting and publishing research papers, working papers, op-eds, and other written products; present findings clearly to the team; participate in public-facing research projects by preparing talking points and materials. The position reports to the Public Sector Data Manager and focuses on the Global Clean Energy Investment Monitor (GCIM), a joint project with MIT’s Center for Energy and Environmental Research and the Rhodium Group.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree and minimum seven years of experience in data analysis, including collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and synthesizing complex datasets; at least 4 years of research experience in government or public policy; exceptional data analysis skills, including Excel; excellent written and verbal communication skills; experience advising senior officers; demonstrated organizational and collaborative abilities. Experience with data transformation and analysis in Python and experience with Git and GitHub/GitLab, preferred. Job #24718-10

12/23/24
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
DUTIES


 * Interpret data, formulate reports, and make recommendations based upon the research findings
 * Design and support data visualizations, including dashboards
 * Apply descriptive statistical analysis to data
 * Create, document, and implement quality control procedures that eliminate data errors
 * Gather data sources to address data issues identified by internal and external reviews
 * Prepare and deliver presentations, reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in operational models and workflow procedures
 * Create or update documents required as part of business and functional requirements
 * Conduct routine ad hoc data runs and prepare write-ups in response to data queries
 * Revise processing operations to incorporate new data elements and data quality control and timeliness procedures related to new elements
 * Provide technical support as necessary
   
   

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS


 * Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a relevant field, plus a minimum of 3+ years' experience in a business analyst or data analyst role
 * Experience using Excel and SQL, SAS, or other programming languages to query and summarize data from extracts or large databases for generating reports and to aid decision-making
 * Data visualization experience using dashboards in Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
 * Experience developing business process models and workflow diagrams
 * Advanced Excel skills (task automation; dynamic reports with PivotTables; building formulae; cell formatting; building charts and graphs; large data management with IF, SUM, INDEX, MATCH, VLOOKUP functions)
 * Familiarity with one or more programming languages (e.g., SAS, Python, R)
 * Strong problem-solving skills
 * Strong written and verbal communications skills
   
   

PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS


 * Experience with Atlassian products Jira and Confluence
 * Experience with Agile development processes
 * Experience maintaining relational databases using SQL
 * Certification in one or more programming languages (e.g., SAS, Python, R)
 * Strong proficiency with MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, and Outlook) to create complex documents, manage schedules, and analyze data
 * Effective organizational, planning, and time-management skills
 * Experience with claims data or health information management

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
_______This is a W2 role______




Title: Data Analyst V

Location: Beaverton OR (Onsite)

Duration: 6 Months Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $62.00/hour (all inclusive)




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis, data modeling, and the use of various data tools and services. You will play a critical role in the creation of Source to Target (S2T) mappings, data profiling, and building comprehensive data models. If you are experienced in SQL, Databricks, and AWS services, and you enjoy working with data to derive insights and support decision-making, we would love to hear from you.




Key Responsibilities:

• Create and maintain Source to Target mapping documents, ensuring the successful flow of data from source systems to target destinations.

• Conduct data profiling activities to understand data content, structure, and quality, identifying any discrepancies or issues.

• Develop data models to support various analytical initiatives and collaborate with stakeholders to understand data needs.

• Build and maintain expertise in data modeling best practices to ensure data structures support business requirements effectively.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and interpret requirements, delivering data models that align with organizational goals.

• Utilize SQL, Databricks, and AWS services to develop and optimize queries, transformations, and data processes.

• Perform data validation, data cleansing, and ensure data quality to support high data reliability.




Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field with a minimum 5-7 years of experience.

• Proven experience in data mapping, data modeling, and data profiling.

• Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.

• Hands-on experience with Databricks for building, optimizing, and maintaining data workflows.

• Experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, Redshift, RDS) for data storage, analysis, and ETL processes.

• Familiarity with data visualization tools is a plus (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).

• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.




Preferred Skills:

• Experience in creating ETL pipelines to support data integration.

• Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain high standards of data quality.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively.




Thanks, And Regards

Lead Technical Recruiter

title: Data Analyst

description:
At OrangePeople we consult for some of the most prestigious brands in the world. We are delighted to inform you that one of the world's most admired automotive company is looking for an analyst or data scientist. If you are someone who thrives working at the intersection of computational science, predictive modeling, and business consulting then this opportunity is for you! The ideal candidate excels at analyzing, manipulating, and cleaning data, building predictive and prescriptive models using various theoretical and computational techniques, extracting insights from models to help inform business decisions, and presenting results and recommendations to various business partners and leaders. Additionally, the ideal candidate will also possess the technical expertise to help transition models from development to production and deploy them efficiently. If you have a passion for end-to-end data solutions and enjoy working in a dynamic, collaborative setting, you could be the perfect fit for our team.

Responsibilities


 * Work closely with team members and business partners to identify and prioritize key questions and drive impactful data-based decisions.
 * Extract, manipulate, and clean data from diverse sources using SQL and Python, preparing it for detailed analysis and model development.
 * Develop and implement sophisticated predictive and prescriptive models using statistical and machine learning techniques.
 * Ensure these models address key business challenges and deliver actionable insights.
 * Create clear, compelling data visualizations to effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Effectively and efficiently transition models from development to production within the organization's existing cloud ecosystem.
 * Participate actively in project planning and prioritization sessions to ensure data initiatives align with business goals.
 * Stay updated with the latest industry trends and tools and integrate this knowledge to improve methodologies and solutions.
   
   

Requirements:

Qualifications/ What you bring (Must Haves) Highlight Top 3-5 skills


 * Master's degree or higher in a relevant analytical field.
 * Hands-on experience building and optimizing data solutions using Python.
 * Experience solving problems using a variety of statistical and machine-learning techniques.
 * Hands-on experience using statistical or machine learning frameworks to solve a variety of real-world problems (e.g., statsmodels, scikit-learn, PyTorch).
 * Knowledge of methods like Logistic Regression, Time Series Analysis, GLMs, Mixed Modeling, Multivariate Statistics, Predictive Modeling, Decision Trees, Gradient-Boosted Trees, Random Forests, and Neural Networks.
 * A proactive approach to identifying problems and developing innovative solutions.
   
   

Added Bonus If You Have (Preferred)


 * Experience with version control systems such as GitHub, and familiarity with CI/CD practices to streamline model deployment and code management.
 * Hands-on experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms (e.g., AWS SageMaker or Azure ML) to leverage scalable computing resources and tools.
 * Demonstrated ability to lead through influence, effectively navigating and prioritizing complex cross-departmental projects to drive impactful change.
 * Capability to replace and bridge existing legacy infrastructure and processes.
   
   

Benefits:


 * 401(k).
 * Dental Insurance.
 * Health insurance.
 * Vision insurance.
 * We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity, equality, inclusion, and respect for people.
 * The salary will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, location, relevant education, qualifications, experience, technical skills, and business needs.
   
   

Additional Responsibilities:


 * Participate in OrangePeople monthly team meetings, and participate in team-building efforts.
 * Contribute to OrangePeople technical discussions, peer reviews, etc.
 * Contribute content and collaborate via the OP-Wiki/Knowledge Base.
 * Provide status reports to OP Account Management as requested.
   
   

About us:

OrangePeople is an Enterprise Architecture and Project Management solutions company. Our most valuable asset is our people: dynamic, creative thinkers, who are passionate about doing quality work. As a member of the OrangePeople team, you will have access to industry-leading consulting practices, strategies & and technologies, innovative training & and education. An ideal Orange Person is a technology leader with a proven track record of technical achievements and a strong process/methodology orientation.
title: Analyst, Data Science

description:
What Data Analytics brings to Cardinal Health:

Data Analytics is responsible for applying business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant, and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives. Support Medical supply chain and logistics businesses by developing, managing, and maintaining data-driven tools and actionable insights.



ResponsibilitiesThe role will work across the supply chain with different levels of the organization, gathering data and analytics requirements, driving data acquisition, ingestion & curation to deliver trusted actionable results in a clear and concise manner.

 * The role will also manage existing tools, such as scorecards and dashboards, and look for ways to enhance or improve upon speed, process flow, functionality, and overall value.
 * Uses knowledge of business and data to discover and/or anticipate problems or opportunities where data can be leveraged to address the need.
 * Asks probing questions to translate business needs in order to build and design reporting solutions (metric management, dashboards, enterprise performance management).
 * Applies data visualization, descriptive and summary statistical techniques for discovery and timely insights (data exploration, ad-hoc queries, and analysis).
 * Interprets results of analyses, identifies trends and issues (forecasting), and develops alternatives to support business objectives.
 * Applies data aggregation, descriptive analysis and data presentation techniques and tools to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action.
 * Demonstrates ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex information to a variety of audiences and mediums.
 * Prioritizes and organizes tasks to deliver on time
 * Clearly articulates progress updates, highlights risks with mitigation plans early and manages issues effectively



Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalent work experience, preferred
 * 4-8 years of experience, preferred
 * Experience with data query, visualization, dashboard and/or scorecard tools preferredAbility to collect, synthesize, and interpret information from multiple sources as well as provide easy to understand recommendations
 * Strong mathematical and statistical skills
 * Prefer experience in Data Movement and Processing Technologies and Cloud Data Warehouse technologies including but not limited to experience with GCP, Big Query, Google Cloud Storage, Apache Spark
 * Strong knowledge and experience with Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, SAP, GCP/Big Query, and Python/R is preferred.
 * Distribution/Supply Chain experience a plus
 * Ability to travel up to 10% of the time domestically



What is expected of you and others at this level

 * Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
 * May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
 * Works on complex projects of large scope
 * Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
 * Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
 * Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
 * May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues



Anticipated salary range: $79,700 - $113,800

Bonus eligible: No

Benefits: Cardinal Health offers a wide variety of benefits and programs to support health and well-being.

 * Medical, dental and vision coverage
 * Paid time off plan
 * Health savings account (HSA)
 * 401k savings plan
 * Access to wages before pay day with myFlexPay
 * Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
 * Short- and long-term disability coverage
 * Work-Life resources
 * Paid parental leave
 * Healthy lifestyle programs

Application window anticipated to close: 1/20/2025 *if interested in opportunity, please submit application as soon as possible.

The salary range listed is an estimate. Pay at Cardinal Health is determined by multiple factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographical location, relevant education, experience and skills and an evaluation of internal pay equity.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.



Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.
