title: Data Visualization Specialist

description:
As a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll specialize in collecting, organizing and analyzing data from various sources with the purpose of turning numbers into context and recommendations. You’ll paint a picture of how the business is operating using a variety of data analysis techniques and statistics. You’ll integrate, transform and improve volumes of data at the project or company level for streamlined processes, greater efficiencies and more informed decision-making. You’ll demonstrate leadership among peers and an extremely deep knowledge of your industry and business.

About The Role


 * Proactively identify and communicate business opportunities and recommendations using data manipulation, programming, statistics, and data visualization
 * Use data to support and challenge business solutions with executive leadership or other stakeholders
 * Lead design and validation for all phases of research projects, including presentation of results, guiding iterative improvement
 * Maintain relationships and alignment among stakeholders to meet objectives
 * Define, gather, and validate project data requirements and evaluate data quality
 * Create and support business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, reports, or methods
 * Identify, document, and use exploratory data analysis to investigate assumptions
 * Mentor teammates on any of the above responsibilities
   
   

About You

Minimum Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a scientific discipline, mathematics, applied statistics, information technology or a related field
 * 4 years of experience or equivalent competency identifying business problems, conducting data experiments, performing statistical analysis, and synthesizing findings to guide business decisions
 * Experience leading end-to-end data analysis projects resulting in positive business changes
 * Expertise creating data visualizations using modern business intelligence (BI) tools, highlighting insights as relevant
 * Proficiency with Sagemaker, Athena, Python and PySpark
 * Experience creating data sets with advanced SQL or other querying languages and using them to develop business strategies
 * Advanced practical knowledge of standard statistical measures, probability theory and both qualitative and quantitative techniques
 * Experience data mining or using other exploratory techniques
 * Experience working with structured and unstructured data
 * Domain knowledge of multiple business areas
 * Ability to manage multiple priorities, meeting deadlines, and producing quality results, even in challenging or time-sensitive environments
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Comprehensive knowledge of at least one business area and its data, including industry or other external sources
 * Experience in several business areas and familiarity with associated data
 * Conceptual knowledge of big data, machine learning, or data science
   
   

What You’ll Get

Our team members fuel our strategy, innovation and growth, so we ensure the health and well-being of not just you, but your family, too! We go above and beyond to give you the support you need on an individual level and offer all sorts of ways to help you live your best life. We are proud to offer eligible team members perks and health benefits that will help you have peace of mind. Simply put: We’ve got your back. Check out our full list of Benefits and Perks.

About Us

Rocket Mortgage® was founded in 1985. Today, we’re a Detroit-based, publicly traded company with a mission to Help Everyone Home. At Rocket Mortgage, we believe that home is more than the house you live in. Our wide variety of home loan options, tools and resources empower our clients to achieve their homeownership dreams. We’re known as experts in the mortgage industry, but we’re also innovators – we strive to create the best experiences for our clients from beginning to end. And we’re not your typical employer. We’re insistently different in how we look at the world and are committed to an inclusive workplace where every voice is heard. Apply today to join a team that offers career growth, amazing benefits and the chance to work with leading industry professionals.

This job description is an outline of the primary responsibilities of this position and may be modified at the discretion of the Company at any time. Decisions related to employment are not based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. The Company provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable state and federal laws. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in completing the application and/or participating in the application process should contact a member of the Human Resources team, The Pulse, at Careers@myrocketcareer.com.

description:
TRC's Client in Sandy Springs has a direct hire opportunity for an Entry Level Data Engineer!




This position is with the north American headquarters of one of the largest container shipping companies in the world. They will train this person and grow them within the team!



The Entry Level Data Engineer (AKA Data Coordinator) will work as part of a small team to develop Data solutions for internal departments across the organization to drive data insights. Responsibilities include creating dashboards and data pipelines, ETL processes, gathering requirements, etc.




Responsibilities

Leverages the use of data analytics tools (e.g. QlikSense, Databricks, Snowflake, Python, Alteryx, etc.) to implement solutions, and to increase team’s efficiency and reliability.

Manage and oversees cross-functional data analytics projects throughout the entire development cycle (from inception to production), ensuring that quality standards and deadlines are meet.

Participates in the definition of metrics to expand depth of analysis, to improve internal processes and identify quantifiable business opportunities.

Develop and maintain scalable data products for data warehousing (Data Lake concept).

Foster a relationship of trust and cooperation with stakeholders, creating an atmosphere of knowledge and collaboration.

Effectively communicate findings and insights to upper management and internal stakeholders.

Keep up to date with the latest technologies and trends in data analytics to ensure the usage of cutting-edge tools and techniques available.




Required Experience: (Can be from school or internships)

Experience creating SQL queries from scratch

Experience with Python Scripting

Experience with ETL

description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst III for our client in the Utilities industry. This Contract position is located in Corinth, TX 76210.

W2 Hourly Pay rate range: $70-75/hr.

W2 Status:

Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. NO THIRD PARTIES ALLOWED ON THIS ROLE.

Description:

The Business Intelligence Analyst 3 works with Application Teams, IT infrastructure teams, developers, vendors, and business users to ensure rapid thorough analysis of complex business needs, applying analytics techniques and developing solutions to drive strong outcomes. Activities include analyzing and creating reports using documented procedures, assuring quality and data accuracy, and delivering the reports and dashboards on time to internal customers. You will design and create technical solutions to solve business problems and to increase business efficiency. Your designs will be current, insightful, user-friendly and help drive insights from the data. A successful candidate must have strong experience in data analysis, data engineering as well as reporting and analytics tools. Previous technical experience and technical aptitude are required.

Responsibilities:


 * Creates, updates and maintains reporting solutions utilizing Power BI for multiple business partners
 * Engages business partners to understand requirements, map to logical and physical data models and develop thoughtful insights into the data
 * Uses a variety of OLAP tools and methods to access data from a variety of sources such as Oracle, MS SQL server and IBM DB2
 * Creates and runs complex SQL queries to analyze data and develop solutions
 * Provides great service and technical support of issues, including data validation and maintaining reporting accuracy
 * Provides ad hoc query and reporting to business requests, as needed
 * Interfaces with Business Units, Client Services Desk, vendor and other IT areas to develop reporting solutions
 * Provides recommendations on Data Warehousing and cloud architecture
 * Assists manager in developing/revising and documenting policies and procedures for supporting data governance and reporting best practices
 * Complies with established corporate safety and operating rules, procedures and guidelines including reporting unsafe practices to a supervisor
 * Complies with established corporate Information Security Handbook, policies, procedures, and guidelines including reporting suspected information security incidents to Tech Support
   
   

Secondary Position Responsibilities


 * Attends all required company training and employee development
 * Attends monthly department meeting or reviews safety material independently
 * Cross-platform problem solving, solution investigation and delivery
 * Mentors Junior Analysts
 * Participates/represents IT Enterprise Applications during Enterprise and departmental projects
 * Performs other duties and activities as directed
   
   

Requirements:


 * High School Diploma or G.E.D equivalency
 * Bachelor's Degree in Business Analytics, Management Information Systems or Business Computer Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
 * 7 + years as a Business Intelligence Analyst, PowerBI Developer, Data Analyst or Data Engineer
 * Strong Experience in Power BI, developing Reports and Dashboards
 * 4+ years of data warehouse experience
 * Strong SQL skills and knowledge of Data Modeling
 * Experience developing end-to-end solutions
 * Experience in analytical thinking and problem solving
 * Experience in requirements elicitation and preparation of functional design documents
   
   

Desired Skills:


 * PowerBI Certification, a plus
 * Cloud Certifications, a plus
   
   

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply!

Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year—in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.

description:
Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

NBC Sports Next is where sports and technology intersect. We’re fueled by our mission to innovate, create larger-than-life events and connect with sports fans through technology. We’re a subdivision of NBC Sports and home to leading technology platforms and digital applications for Youth & Recreational Sports; Golf; and Emerging Media.  

At NBC Sports Next, we equip more than 30MM players, coaches, athletes, sports administrators and fans in 40 countries with more than 25 sports solution products, including SportsEngine, the largest youth sports club, league and team management platform; SportsEngine Play, the first ever streaming service for youth and amateur sports, GolfNow, the leading online tee time marketplace and provider of golf course operations technology; and GolfPass the ultimate golf membership that connects golfers to exclusive content, tee time credits, instructional content and more.  

This role is part of our Youth & Recreational Sports group, comprised of technology platforms such as SportsEngine HQ, SportsEngine Motion, SportsEngine Play and SportsEngine Tourney. We enable athletes, parents, coaches and team administrators in the youth and recreational space to manage their organizations, collect payments, share schedules, find programs to participate in and connect with other families. Additionally, NCSI enables leagues and organizations to properly screen and train coaches in an effort to keep kids safe. 

Job Description

The Operations Analyst – NCSI will work closely with key leaders and teams within Youth & Recreation Sports to help deliver an unparalleled internal/external customer experience. This role will identify innovative solutions and best practices that should result in efficiencies and department optimization. This role will be responsible for applying a broad range of knowledge and experience with minimal supervision.

Job Duties


 * Gathers and analyzes company data from workflows, collaborative discussions, and reports; makes informed recommendations based on findings and evaluates the outcomes of newly implemented procedures.
 * Supports operational process reviews including preparing necessary materials, generating reports, and providing regular status updates.
 * Conducts research and data analysis to identify trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations.
 * Builds strong relationships with the Director and Departmental Leaders to gain an in-depth understanding of processes, address challenges, and propose effective solutions.
 * Assesses current production processes and recommends strategic enhancements to optimize business efficiency.
 * Provides ongoing support to the team as needed during and following assigned projects.
 * Prioritizes projects impartially and communicates status updates, key metrics, and progress reports to leadership.
 * Handles confidential and sensitive information daily, and ensures information is being shared between departments and with clients appropriately.
 * Performs additional tasks as assigned to support operational goals
   
   

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications


 * Comprehensive understanding of best practices in multi-platform and multi-stakeholder environments.
 * 2+ years of experience in business operations or related analytical role, with proven track record of driving process improvements and supporting operational success.
 * Possess intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data entry, calculations, formatting, and visualization.
 * Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
 * Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing priorities and demands.
 * Proficient in utilizing various tools and resources to present analyses and share insights with key stakeholders.
 * Skilled at evaluating data and making informed decisions based on available information.
 * Self-motivated and capable of working independently, while also excelling in collaborative environments across different time zones.
   
   

Desired Characteristics


 * Previous experience with business management platforms including both vendor and internal proprietary platforms.
   
   

Additional Job Requirements


 * Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office, a minimum of three days per week.
 * Must be willing to work in the Orlando, FL office.
   
   

Additional Information

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Analytics Consultant

description:
Job Description

This Opportunity

WSP is currently initiating a search for a Traffic Data Analyst to support our Denver, CO office. This position is a special assignment with the Federal Highway Association (FHWA), to work on National Park Service (NPS) traffic data. If the client contract is terminated or expires, the employee will be assimilated into the WSP Office and will be involved in active traffic engineering related projects for other clients.

Your Impact


 * FHWA National Park Service assignment
    * Work on the NPS Traffic Data Annual Report, including preparing park chapters.
    * Investigate new traffic counting technologies and determine the applicability to different physical environments in the NPS.
    * Analyze traffic data in select parks for traffic patterns.
    * Compile data requests for traffic data, as needed.
    * Create/update count stations in the Traffic Database.
    * Assist the FOTSC Manager in the creation of the NPS Traffic Data Annual Report.
    * Prepare Park chapters in the NPS Traffic Data Annual Report.
    * Conduct field work, scoping new count stations and/or inspecting/repairing existing count stations based on FOTSC’s specifications and creating inspection reports.
    * Review inspection reports created by FHWA or its contractors.
    * Provide backup support other FOTSC staff.
    * Review and provide QC on monthly traffic data from NPS
    * Develop and update QA/QC procedures.
    * Drive Federal government vehicles.

 * Perform professional traffic monitoring and analysis work and assist with conducting investigations and inspections of proposed and existing site conditions, roadways, intersections, signage, signals, pavement markings, and transportation corridors to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, and construction or operating permits.
 * Work collaboratively with other engineers, planners, scientific professionals, and DOT authorities on Federal, State, regional, and locally funded road and transportation improvement and development projects.
 * Assist in the preparation and implementation of site Health and Safety Plans (HASPs).
 * Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
 * Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.
   

Who You Are

Required Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s Degree in Enginering, Math, Data Analysis, Accounting, Finance or related field.
 * Candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.
 * Candidate must be able to pass a Federal background check.
 * 3 to 5 years of relevant post education experience in engineering, statistics, data analytics, or related discipline.
 * Field work may require hiking up to 0.5 miles in rugged terrain.
 * The National Park Service requires all contractors to go through a complete security clearance check prior to accessing the NPS work site.
 * The ability to travel to client sites (National Parks) approximately five to seven times a year.
 * The ability to report to the Lakewood, CO office in-person 5 days a week.
 * Knowledge with DOT advisory circulars and procedures is preferred.
 * Ability to coordinate with agency regulators and understand requirements.
 * Proficient in Microsoft offices (Word, excel, etc.)
 * Capable interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.
 * Effective self-leadership with attention to detail, results orientation, and managing multiple priorities in a dynamic work environment.
 * Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, work independently, and comply with company policies.
 * Moderate proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, math principles, predictive models, spreadsheets, and tools.
 * Critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply technical knowledge to reach conclusions from testing results, data collation, statistical analysis and arriving at the most effective, economical, and logical solution.
 * Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
 * Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Prior experience within the engineering consulting industry is preferred.
   
   

WSP Benefits

WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. These benefits include coverage related to medical, dental, vision, disability, and life; retirement savings; paid sick leave; paid vacation (or other personal time); paid parental leave; and paid time off for purposes of bereavement, voting, and/or attendance at naturalization proceedings.

Compensation

Expected Salary (Colorado): $82,400 - $98,000

WSP USA is providing the compensation range that the company in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position within the state of Colorado, based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and specific geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, and/or federal law.

About WSP

ABOUT US

WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.

www.wsp.com

WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.

At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?

WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.

The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.

Notice To Third Party Agencies

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or other staffing services. Unsolicited resumes include any resume or hiring document sent to WSP in the absence of a signed Service Agreement where WSP has expressly requested recruitment/staffing services specific to the position at hand. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, will become the property of WSP and WSP will have the right to hire that candidate without reservation – no fee or other compensation will be owed or paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service.
title: Traffic Data Analyst

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION




As an FBI special agent with data engineering and big data experience, you'll directly impact national security. By harnessing your background to transition into federal law enforcement, you can help shape the Bureau’s approach to safeguarding our nation. At the FBI, you will have the opportunity to channel your data science, cloud infrastructure, or IoT systems expertise to disrupt public corruption, organized crime, civil rights violations, and more. From conducting high-stakes investigations to leveraging your depth of knowledge in predictive modeling to identify trends and prevent criminal activity, your unique skills are essential to investigating crimes that affect communities nationwide. Your transition from a specialized career to a special agent role will be transformative as you employ your expertise to tackle national security challenges in innovative ways. Dive into investigations and collaborative problem-solving, where your insights in advanced statistical modeling or data governance can help solve complex cases and build trust within communities as you investigate white-collar crimes that erode public trust. Every day brings new challenges that demand your adaptability and resilience, but you’re not alone in this journey. The Bureau matches your dedication with a commitment to professional growth, a supportive work environment, and a robust benefits package that prioritizes you. Unlock your next achievement and begin a rewarding career with the nation’s premier law enforcement agency: the FBI.




SALARY LEVEL




Pay level for this position:

 * $97,300.00–$125,543.00




Salary is commensurate with experience and location. Upon graduation, new special agent salaries plus AVP range from $81,243.00–$129,717.00.




DUTIES

 * Plan and conduct investigations of potential violations of federal laws, cybersecurity, and public safety.
 * Exercise judgment, resourcefulness, and versatility in meeting investigative demands.
 * Create and maintain effective liaison relationships with federal, state, local, tribal, territorial, and international law enforcement agencies.
 * Maintain a level of physical fitness to ensure the readiness required to perform law enforcement duties.




KEY REQUIREMENTS

 * Must be a U.S. citizen.
 * Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) Clearance.
 * Must be willing to travel as required.
 * Must meet the FBI’s Employment Eligibility requirements.
 * Must have a bachelor’s degree or higher from a U.S.-accredited college or university.




The FBI is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for this vacancy. Unless explicitly authorized by law, selection will be made without regard to, and there will be no discrimination because of, color, race, religion, national origin, marital status, parental status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, age (40 or over), sex (including pregnancy and related conditions, gender identity, and sexual orientation), or on the basis of personal favoritism, or any other nonmerit factors.
sector: Law Enforcement, Armed Forces, and Government Administration
title: FBI Special Agent: Data Science & Intelligence Expertise

description:
This is a remote position.

Data BI Analyst - US Only

Experience: 1+ years

Employment Type: Full-time, Remote

Base Salary: $55K-$70K

Phoenix Recruitment offers a variety of recruiting services to assist both employers and employees. They are specialized in marketing open positions, recruiting, and helping employers to find qualified candidates across various industries. Phoenix Recruitment has expertise in streamlining the hiring process. They can help ensure that the process is efficient, well organized, and compliant with relevant regulations.

Are you a talented BI Analyst with a passion for data analysis and a strong background in business intelligence? We are seeking a skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a BI Analyst. As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.

Responsibilities:


 * Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
 * Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business decision-making.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
 * Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and provide actionable recommendations.
 * Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.
   
   

Requirements:


 * Bachelor's Degree required with an emphasis in business, economics, math, engineering, or analytics preferred. Advanced degree or certification preferred.
 * 1+ years of experience, with at least 1 year of analytic experience.
 * Proficiency in interacting with various database and file storage systems (Examples: Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL). Understanding of join types.
 * Experience with data manipulation languages, such as SQL, is required.
 * Knowledge of statistical concepts and analytic techniques, including descriptive statistics, forecasting, economic modeling, exploratory analysis, and variance analysis required.
 * Ability to perform uni variate analytic analytical techniques.
 * Experience using Microsoft Excel, including the use of pivot tables, formulas, macros, VBA, charts/graphs.
 * Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView.
 * Strong analytical, critical, and systems thinking required.
   
   

Skills:


 * Good understanding of Agile framework (SCRUM).
 * Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus.
   
   

Benefits:


 * Competitive salary based on skills, qualifications, and experience 1.
 * Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.
 * Retirement program with lifetime pension benefits.
 * Paid time off and holidays.
 * Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
 * Opportunities for professional development and growth.
 * Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
   
   

Why Phoenix Recruitment LLC?

Phoenix Recruitment often has an extensive network of employers and candidates. This network allows them to tap into a pool of qualified candidates and connect them with suitable job opportunities. They can also leverage their connections to help employers find the right talent efficiently. Outsourcing the recruitment process to a specialized agency can save you time and resources, avoid delays, reduce administrative burdens, and increase the chances of finding the right fit for your organization.

description:
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in our Boston or Houston office, joining the Energy Solutions team within McKinsey’s Global Energy & Materials practice.

As a global leader in energy intelligence and analytics, Energy Solutions leverages cutting-edge data and technology to empower organizations across the entire energy value chain. Our team of world-class data scientists and analysts transform data into actionable insights, enabling clients to make well-informed strategic, tactical, and operational decisions. We help organizations capture opportunities, manage risks, and enhance performance.

What You'll Do

As a Knowledge Analyst with Energy Solutions, you will help clients in the energy sector (across supply and demand) and beyond to improve performance and operations and make strategic decisions for the future.

In this role, you will provide daily problem-solving, structuring, modeling, and analytical support for our Energy Solutions tools and analyses. You will gather information to develop these tools/benchmarks and synthesize findings into McKinsey-formatted products, such as complex models, summary reports, and standalone presentations for internal and external audiences.

You will collaborate with other experts to solve client problems, deepening your knowledge and refining your analytical and thought-partnership skills.

You’ll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.

Qualifications


 * Undergraduate degree in engineering, management, economics, science or other degree with a quantitative focus
 * Experience (internships and/or full-time) in the energy industry; such as oil & gas, power, sustainable fuels, decarbonization, solar grids, etc.
 * Experience with modeling capability tools such as Python or R
 * Proficiency in Excel and familiarity with Tableau
 * Advanced problem-solving skills with a strong aptitude for working with numbers and quantitative models
 * Proven ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and engage with individuals at all organizational levels
 * Capacity to excel in a fast-paced, results-driven team setting, demonstrating a steep learning curve and a strong commitment to coaching and development
 * Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas in English, both verbally and in writing
sector: Chemical Manufacturing, Oil and Gas, and Utilities
title: Knowledge Analyst - Energy Solutions

description:
HHAeXchange is the leading technology platform for home and community-based care. Founded in 2008, HHAeXchange was born out of an idea to create a fully comprehensive end-to-end homecare solution to help people who are aging or have disabilities thrive in their homes and communities. Our employees are passionate about transforming the healthcare space by building the only homecare ecosystem that fully connects patients, personal care providers, managed care organizations, and states.

HHAeXchange is seeking a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Operations team. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Data, Analytics, & Business Intelligence, this role will drive data-driven decision-making across key internal functions.

The Analyst will manage the complete data lifecycle, from data engineering through analysis and visualization:


 * Build and automate ETL pipelines
 * Design and maintain data models
 * Create automated reporting solutions and BI dashboards
 * Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover actionable insights
 * Partner with stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver data-driven solutions
   
   
   

Beyond technical responsibilities, the role requires strong partnership skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and leadership. The ideal candidate will:


 * Understand and translate diverse stakeholder data needs into actionable solutions
 * Champion data governance within their domain
 * Stay current with analytics and BI industry trends to drive continuous improvement
   
   
   

This position balances technical expertise with strong business partnership, requiring someone who can both execute and influence across the organization.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Job Duties


 * Design, deploy, and manage robust data models, reports, and dashboards.
 * Conduct scheduled and ad-hoc data analyses to identify opportunities and risks, providing evidence-based recommendations to boost productivity, improve performance, and enhance operational efficiency.
 * Automate routine reporting tasks to streamline processes.
 * Train staff and leadership on interpreting and operationalizing dashboards and reports.
 * Develop a feedback loop with functional support staff and leadership to continuously refine dashboards, analytics models, and reporting tools.
 * Collaborate with Business Operations and functional support leadership to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
 * Drive a culture of standardization, continuous improvement, and evidence-based decision-making.
 * Proactively monitor and analyze leading and lagging indicators to inform strategic planning.
 * Identify opportunities to elevate operational sophistication and business intelligence maturity through advanced analytics, employing statistical methods, machine learning, and AI.
   
   
   

Other Job Duties


 * Other duties as assigned by supervisor or HHAeXchange leader.
   
   
   

Travel Requirements


 * Travel up to 10%, including overnight travel
   
   
   

Required Education, Experience, Certifications, And Skills


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, Math, or Statistics.
 * 2+ years of professional experience, with at least 1 year of analytical experience.
 * Prior experience in a SaaS or consulting environment.
 * Ability to deliver impactful data solutions in a format understandable to a non-technical audience.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities with ability to understand the "big picture" yet preserve a keen eye for details.
 * Experience with database query languages, such as SQL/Snowflake/Postgres.
 * Experience with Microsoft Excel, including use of Array formulas, Index/Match, etc.
 * Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau/Qlik/PowerBI.
 * Strong verbal and written communication skills.
 * Ability to multitask and produce consistent results in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines and priorities.
 * Self-starter with a proactive approach to identifying and solving challenge.
   
   
   

The base salary range for this US-based, full-time, and exempt position is $85,000-100,000 not including variable compensation. An employee’s exact starting salary will be based on various factors including but not limited to experience, education, training, merit, location, and the ability to exemplify the HHAeXchange core values.

This is a benefits-eligible position. HHAeXchange offers competitive health plans, paid time-off, company paid holidays, 401K retirement program with a Company elected match, including other company sponsored programs.

HHAeXchange is an equal-opportunity employer. The Company offers employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, citizenship, genetic information, hairstyles, or any other status protected by local or federal law.

description:
Unlock Your Potential with Refonte AI’s AI & Data Science Internship Program!

Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science? Want to work on real-world projects and gain hands-on experience while learning from industry experts? Join Refonte AI’s AI & Data Science Internship Program, and take your career to the next level! This is your chance to work on cutting-edge technologies like machine learning, deep learning, data analytics, and AI-driven solutions with a dynamic, diverse team spread across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA).




Discover more about Refonte AI: https://refontelearning.com/




Job Title: AI & Data Science Intern




Location: Remote, United States of America (USA)




Company: Refonte AI




About Refonte AI

Refonte AI is a global leader in AI and Data Science, providing top-notch IT and EdTech services. We specialize in creating AI-driven solutions, data analytics, predictive models, and much more to help businesses across industries leverage the power of data. Our commitment to innovation, excellence, and empowering talent has made us a trusted partner for clients worldwide.




Job Summary:

Refonte AI is offering an exciting opportunity for aspiring AI & Data Science Interns to join our prestigious program. This internship is designed to help you develop your skills from beginner to advanced levels while contributing to impactful projects that address real-world problems. You’ll collaborate with an international team across multiple continents, gaining exposure to both AI technologies and data science best practices.




Roles & Responsibilities:

As an AI & Data Science Intern, you will gain hands-on experience in the following areas:

 * Data Collection & Analysis: Work with data scientists to collect, clean, and analyze large datasets, uncovering valuable insights.
 * Model Development: Assist in the design and implementation of machine learning models to solve complex business challenges.
 * Data Pipeline Creation: Contribute to building scalable data pipelines to process data for model training and deployment.
 * AI Algorithm Optimization: Help optimize AI algorithms for better accuracy and efficiency in real-time applications.
 * Predictive Analytics: Use statistical and machine learning techniques to create predictive models and assist in data-driven decision-making.
 * Collaborative Innovation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to deploy AI models and tools across multiple platforms.
 * Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest AI research and tools, and apply new knowledge to improve project outcomes.
 * Documentation & Reporting: Assist in documenting methodologies, processes, and results to ensure smooth project execution.




Projects You Will Work On

 * Predictive Analytics: Developing models to forecast trends and behaviors based on historical data.
 * AI Model Deployment: Work on the integration and deployment of AI models into production systems for large-scale use.
 * Natural Language Processing (NLP): Help create models that process and understand human language in various forms (text, speech).
 * Computer Vision: Work on projects involving object detection, facial recognition, and image classification.
 * AI Chatbots & Automation: Assist in creating intelligent chatbots for improved customer interactions.
 * Data Visualization: Create impactful visualizations to help stakeholders understand complex data insights.
 * AI for Business Applications: Collaborate on AI-driven tools and software solutions for clients across multiple industries.




Who We’re Looking For

 * Academic Background: Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related fields.
 * Passion for Learning: Strong interest in AI, machine learning, and data science, and a drive to continuously expand your knowledge.
 * Technical Skills: Basic understanding of programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with data analysis tools.
 * Excellent Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 * Team Player: Able to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional environment, demonstrating adaptability and enthusiasm for team-based problem solving.




Why Join Us?

 * Hands-On Learning: Gain valuable, real-world experience in AI, machine learning, data analytics, and more.
 * Global Exposure: Work remotely with a global team across Europe, Middle East, and Africa.
 * Cutting-Edge Projects: Contribute to innovative AI solutions that are solving industry challenges.
 * Career Development: Learn from experienced professionals and enhance your career opportunities in the rapidly growing field of AI and data science.
 * Flexible Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of a remote work environment while building your technical expertise.




Application Process

This is an unpaid internship program under the Refonte AI Global Training & Internship Program (RIGTIP). Upon applying, our team will contact you with further instructions on the next steps in the application process.




Discover more about Refonte AI: https://refontelearning.com/




Location

This is a remote internship open to candidates from USA.




Apply Now

If you're passionate about AI and data science, eager to gain practical experience, and ready to take on exciting challenges, we encourage you to apply today!




Refonte AI looks forward to helping you unlock your potential and grow your career in the exciting world of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science.




Thank you for considering Refonte AI for your internship journey. We are excited to have you join our dynamic and innovative team!
sector: Higher Education, Education, and IT Services and IT Consulting
title: AI & Data Science Intern

description:
Position Summary

The Senior Analyst Revenue Forecasting and Data Analytics reports revenue to internal JetBlue leadership and answers complex revenue questions with data. The Sr. Analyst will provide enhancements to improve revenue reporting and forecasting accuracy. In addition, the Sr. Analyst will present analysis and ad hoc reporting to leadership.

Essential Responsibilities


 * Monitor daily revenue and booking trends and adjusts the revenue forecast appropriately
 * Develops dashboards for use within our team and other teams. Solicits feedback from dashboard users and incorporates it as needed
 * Has a deep understanding our data structure and is able to answer ad hoc questions with little manager guidance
 * Develops reporting for other teams at JetBlue and works with them to ensure reports meet their needs
 * Able to lead data improvement projects working with other teams
 * Monitors revenue and booking trends and adjusts revenue forecast appropriately
 * Perform ad hoc analysis and makes recommendations in support of revenue initiatives
 * Provide direct support to leadership requests
 * Other duties as assigned
   
   
   

Minimum Experience And Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or relevant field; OR demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities with the combination of a High School Diploma/GED and at least four (4) years of previous relevant work experience
 * Three (3) years of analytical or quantitative experience
 * Fluent in SQL coding language
 * Excellent analytical skills
 * Ability to work independently and in a team environment
 * Experience with analyzing Big Data
 * Experience in array of analysis tools (i.e. Access, Excel, SQL)
 * Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools
 * Ability to learn new computer programs and applications
 * Available for occasional overnight travel (10%)
 * Must pass a pre-employment drug test
 * Must be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located
 * Authorization to work in the US is required, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
   
   
   

Preferred Experience And Qualifications


 * Experience within airline industry
 * Five (5) years of modeling, forecasting, and analysis experience
 * Full understanding of Tableau software
   
   
   

Crewmember Expectations:


 * Regular attendance and punctuality
 * Potential need to work flexible hours and be available to respond on short-notice
 * Able to maintain a professional appearance
 * When working or traveling on JetBlue flights, and if time permits, all capable crewmembers are asked to assist with light cleaning of the aircraft
 * Must be an appropriate organizational fit for the JetBlue culture, that is, exhibit the JetBlue values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion and Fun
 * Promote JetBlue’s #1 value of safety as a Safety Ambassador, supporting JetBlue’s Safety Management System (SMS) components, Safety Policy and behavioral standards
 * Identify safety and/or security concerns, issues, incidents or hazards that should be reported and report them whenever possible and by any means necessary including JetBlue’s confidential reporting systems (Aviation Safety Action Program (ASAP) or Safety Action Report (SAR))
   
   
   

Equipment:


 * Computer and other office equipment
   
   
   

Work Environment:


 * Traditional office environment
   
   
   

Physical Effort:


 * Generally not required, or up to 10 pounds occasionally, 0 pounds frequently. (Sedentary)
   
   
   

Compensation:


 * The base pay range for this position is between $64,000.00 and $103,100.00 per year. Base pay is one component of JetBlue’s total compensation package, which may also include access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, crewmember stock purchase plan, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, free space available travel on JetBlue, and more.)

description:
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences - the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment, filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

Job Details


 * Location: Austin, TX, United States
 * Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time40 hours a week, either in a hybrid work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term
 * Duration: May 2025 to August 2025
   
   
   

What You Will Be Doing

We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst intern/co-op to join our team and work on data, statistical analysis, performance analysis, quality assurance, and data interpretation. In this role -


 * Your responsibility will be to analyze and organize raw data to craft proofs of concepts, prototype, and implement solutions using relevant analysis methods and visualization techniques
 * We will involve you in data analysis assignments and report results. Additionally, we would train to build data for prescriptive and predictive modeling to generate business foresights
 * We will assign tasks for building reports, presentation and crafting dashboards using data visualization tools
   
   
   

Who We Are Looking For


 * You are currently enrolled in a United States based University into a Undergrad program majoring in Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, Computer Science or a related field
 * If you have knowledge / experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply -
 * Python, SQL, R, Java
 * Data processing, data engineering and/or data science
 * Kubernetes, Tableu, PowerBi, data analytics
 * Microsoft cloud services like Azure and AKS
 * Snowflake, Oracle, SQL server data platform
 * Software development (including design, implementation, testing, and other related work)
 * Database design and data modeling
   
   
   

Note: By submitting your application, you are indicating your interest in AMD intern positions. We are recruiting for multiple positions, and if your experience aligns with any of our intern opportunities, a recruiter will contact you.

At AMD, your base pay is one part of your total rewards package. Your base pay will depend on where your skills, qualifications, experience, and location fit into the hiring range for the position. You may be eligible for incentives based upon your role such as either an annual bonus or sales incentive. Many AMD employees have the opportunity to own shares of AMD stock, as well as a discount when purchasing AMD stock if voluntarily participating in AMD’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also be eligible for competitive benefits described in more detail here.

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.
title: Data Analyst Intern/Co-Op (Undergrad | Summer 2025 |Hybrid)

description:
*THIS IS AN UNPAID INTERNSHIP POSITION. YOU WILL BE GATHERING DATA, READING AND WRITING IN ONE OF THESE LANGUAGES LISTED BELOW. THEREFORE, YOU MUST BE NATIVELY FLUENT IN ONE OF THESE LANGUAGES TO APPLY - GERMAN, ITALIAN, FRENCH, PORTUGUESE, ARABIC, AND/OR SPANISH. PLEASE STATE WHICH LANGUAGE YOU HAVE NATIVE FLUENCY IN. YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO PASS A LANGUAGE FLUENCY TEST*




About Huro AI:

Huro empowers visionaries by dismantling global barriers in language, knowledge, networking, and trade through seamless AI technology. We are dedicated to constructing the first equitable #SLM and #LLM to properly support an AGI-enabled humanity with a novel approach that prioritizes integrity, human relationships, digital rights, and uncompromising data quality. We are eager to welcome new team members who embody uncompromising principles.




Role Description

As a Data Engineer Intern at HURO AI, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with a passionate team on innovative projects. You’ll design, develop, and optimize data pipelines, enhance data integration processes, and contribute to the foundation of a global AI-driven ecosystem. This role provides an excellent platform to develop technical expertise, gain valuable experience, and potentially transition into a full-time position within the company.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Pipeline Development:

 * Build scalable, robust data pipelines to support large-scale data processing and analytics.
 * Collaborate with the team to integrate data from diverse sources, ensuring consistency and security.

Data Modeling and Storage Optimization:

 * Support the creation and optimization of efficient data models and schemas.
 * Help manage data storage systems, including relational and NoSQL databases.

Cloud Integration and Big Data Solutions:

 * Gain hands-on experience with cloud-based data services on platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
 * Integrate big data tools like Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Kafka into our infrastructure.

Data Quality and Troubleshooting:

 * Monitor data pipeline performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure system reliability.
 * Assist in data validation and quality assurance processes to maintain data accuracy.

Documentation and Collaboration:

 * Document workflows, processes, and best practices to ensure team knowledge sharing.
 * Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including AI and software engineers, to deliver impactful solutions.




Required Skills:

 * Data Engineering, Data Modeling, and ETL skills.
 * Data Warehousing and Data Analytics skills.
 * Experience with data manipulation and transformation.
 * Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms).
 * Proficiency in programming languages like Python, SQL, or Java.
 * Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
 * Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.




What We’re Looking For:

 * Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
 * Hands-on experience with data manipulation, transformation, and modeling techniques.
 * Familiarity with ETL processes and data integration solutions.
 * Knowledge of data warehousing and analytics tools.
 * Interest in cloud computing and big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
 * Detail-oriented and proactive, with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively.
 * *MUST BE FLUENT IN GERMAN- READING, WRITING AND SPEAKING*




Why Join Huro AI?

 * Career Development: Gain practical experience in a company that builds a solid foundation for your career.
 * Learning Opportunities: Access ongoing learning and professional development in startup funding and AI technology.
 * Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from industry experts, including direct interaction with senior leadership.
 * Innovative Environment: Contribute to impactful projects at the forefront of AI and machine learning.
 * Collaborative Culture: Be part of a passionate team dedicated to driving innovation and achieving excellence.
 * Professional Growth: Opportunities for career advancement within the company, including the potential to transition into a full-time position.
 * Networking: Build a strong professional network in the venture capital and startup communities.
 * Impactful Work: Contribute to a company committed to making a positive impact through innovative technology.

description:
CBTS serves enterprise and midmarket clients in all industries across the United States and Canada. From developing and deploying modern applications and the secure, scalable platforms on which they run, to managing, monitoring, and optimizing their operations, CBTS delivers comprehensive technology solutions for its clients' transformative business initiatives. For more information, please visit www.cbts.com.

Job Purpose

Responsible for the front end production of data solutions used to drive business value. The Sr. BI Analyst will work with business users to solicit requirements, consolidate data, and provide value-add analysis. The Sr. BI Analyst will be instrumental in the identification and development of data process recommendations that increase the efficiency and effectiveness of enterprise information architecture. This role will provide support to teams and management by collecting data, analyzing structures, and the publishing/maintenance of dashboards/reports for end users.

Essential Functions


 * Work with internal customers to define/refine analytical requirements for dashboarding, prescriptive business metrics and process gaps - 15%
 * Translate business requirements into functional dashboards, standard reports and enterprise data processes - 20%
 * Design and implement data processes for integration into system architectures -15%
 * Produce quarterly, monthly and ad hoc report requests -- 20%
 * Report administration, quality assurance and process documentation -- 15%
 * Data discovery, planning and architecture with Analytics - Insights team -- 15%
   
   

Education


 * Four years of College resulting in a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
   
   

Certifications, Accreditations, Licenses


 * AWS Data Analytics -- Preferred

Special Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


 * 6+ plus years in corporate analytics (Analyst/Engineer/Data Architect) -- Preferred
 * 2+ plus years with ETL Tools -- Preferred
 * Working experience with Rest - SOAP
 * Working experience with either Salesforce or ServiceNow
 * 2+ Years Working Knowledge with Tableau or PowerBI -- Required
 * Experience with Excel, Word, and Office365 Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or later -- Required
 * Experience and demonstrated competency with data visualization -- Required
 * Visual Studio, SSRS, Paginated Reports - Required
 * MySQL working knowledge - Preferred
 * Experience with ETL Tools e.g. Talend, Pentaho -- A plus
 * Familiarity with R - A plus
 * ServiceNow Experience- Preferred

 * Salesforce Experience - Preferred
 * Working Knowledge of Python -- Preferred
 * Strong oral and written communication skills
 * Demonstrated problem solving, critical thinking and communication skills
 * Ability to complete projects and achieve results within the timelines and commitments set forth
 * Excellent planning and organizational skills
 * Ability to work effectively across internal functional areas
 * Demonstrated ability to lead organizational change
 * Self-starter with ability to execute
   
   

Supervisory Responsibility


 * This position does not have employee direct reports but does serve as a lead role for others doing similar work
   
   

Due to U.S. Government requirements applicable to foreign-owned telecommunications providers, non-US citizens may be required to submit to an extensive government agency background check which will necessitate disclosure of sensitive Personally Identifiable Information.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
Overview

We are CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH. Come be part of remarkable.

How You Can Make a Difference

We are looking for a Senior Enterprise Data Analyst who will be reporting directly to our Manager, Data Engineering . This position is responsible for driving the wholistic process of business analytical enablement by engaging with key stakeholders to identify data needed to support key use cases, integrating data from multiple platforms, designing data structures, defining and prototyping business logic, and validating results. The skills required are a unique blend of diverse problem-solving capabilities includi ng analyst, data designer, data engineer, and quality assurance with broad latitude for decision making and solutioning. This senior level position will collaborate with business areas, project teams, and engineering teams to ensure high quality delivery of data focusing on innovation and creativity, enabling value-add to the business on large scale efforts. 

What You’ll Be Doing

Note :   The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Although all the functions listed here are essential, the extent to which a team member may engage in these activities may vary day-to day. Predictable and reliable attendance is an essential function. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.


 * Drive completion of data projects and deliverables including the execution of highly complex data solutions while demonstrating best practices, processes and standards for user story development, data analysis, architecture, modeling, design, coding, and testing .
 * Lead or assist in the development, documentation, and maintenance of the enterprise data architecture and its deliverables including the design principles, models, and mappings for transactional and analytical systems serving both strategic and tactical needs.
 * Work closely with the business, mapping their most pressing business problems to data and analytic solutions.
 * Develop data models and data transformation logic. Work with data engineers to implement data pipelines.
 * Prototype data solutions to enable the measurement or monitoring of key performance indicators.
 * Collaborate with senior management to understand data needs in support of departmental goals.
 * Partner with product owners and managers in developing scope, dependencies, estimates, project plans, schedules, status reporting, and issue/risk management .
 * Become the subject matter expert in multiple data domains .
 * Responsible for defining company standards around data quality.
 * Maximize opportunities to implement self-service to a llow the business to find the data they need quickly, easily and accurately.
 * Enable data science team to build ML models by designing and providing high quality data.
 * Establish and maintain effective and positive relationships with internal and external customers.
   
   

What You Will Need To Be Successful


 * BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and 8 years of work experience.
 * Advanced knowledge in translating business rules to technical data requirements.
 * Advanced SQL knowledge.
 * Expertise in building data warehouses.
 * Advanced knowledge of user story development, data warehouse design and modeling (3rd normal form and dimensional modeling), data integration design and development and/or performance tuning.
 * Excellent skills in coordination with multiple teams for project execution and issue resolution.
 * Demonstrated oral/written communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate complex technical information while inspiring and motivating others.
 * Advanced problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
 * Advanced knowledge of work estimation, design review , code review and data testing techniques .
 * Willingness to play multiple roles for different projects, e.g., data analyst, developer, tester, etc.
 * Advanced knowledge of big data platforms (e.g., DataBricks , Delta Lake, Apache Spark, Snowflake, Redshift) .
 * Experi e nce with Relational Database Management Systems (e.g., Azure SQL, SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
 * Knowledge of ETL processing tools (e.g., DBT, Databricks , Python ).
 * A commitment to data security and privacy.
   
   

This is a remote position.

Salary Range

$115,000.00 To $150,000.00 / year

Benefits & Perks

The compensation range describes the typical minimum or maximum base pay range for this position. The actual compensation offer is determined based on job-related knowledge, education, skills, experience, and work location. This position will be eligible for performance-based incentives and restricted stock units as part of the total compensation package, in addition to a full range in addition to a full range of benefits including:

title: Sr Enterprise Data Analyst

description:
Acture Solutions is seeking an experienced Data & Reporting Analyst. As we continue our journey of expansion and innovation, we need someone with exceptional organizational and analytical skills to support data-driven decision-making and the accurate reporting of data within the Chappaqua School District.

Your Role: Data & Reporting Analyst

As a Data & Reporting Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in collecting, analyzing, and reporting data to meet district, state, and federal requirements. Working closely with administrators and educators, you will ensure data accuracy while supporting continuous improvement initiatives across the Chappaqua School District.

Your Impact

Data Management & Reporting


 * Gather, organize, and maintain data from various sources, ensuring compliance with state and federal guidelines.
 * Generate and submit required reports, including state, federal, and district-specific requests.
 * Perform regular data audits to identify and resolve discrepancies.
   
   

System Administration


 * Manage onboarding and offboarding processes, including user account setup, deletion, and security configurations.
 * Oversee data imports, such as student photos, assessments, and state reporting records.
 * Perform routine daily, weekly, and monthly administrative tasks.
   
   

Help Desk & Application Support


 * Provide support for systems like Infinite Campus, Canvas, and Parent Square.
 * Respond to Help Desk tickets submitted by staff and parents via email, phone, or software, and escalate to vendors when necessary.
   
   

SQL Programming & Technical Expertise


 * Utilize SQL Server, SSRS, and Excel for data manipulation and reporting.
 * Create, run, and manage basic SQL queries and packages to support reporting needs.
   
   

Collaboration & Training


 * Partner with district leaders and educators to develop data strategies aligned with goals.
 * Train staff on data systems, entry protocols, and governance best practices.
   
   

Who You Are: Required Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in data science, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field (relevant experience may substitute for education).
 * Experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in an educational or public sector setting.
 * Technical experience in SQL, Excel.
 * Strong organizational and communication skills to convey data insights effectively to non-technical audiences.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Familiarity with systems such as Infinite Campus, eSchoolData, or other educational data platforms.
 * Knowledge of state and federal reporting requirements and data privacy regulations (e.g., FERPA).
 * A team-oriented mindset with the ability to work independently.
   
   

Work Schedule

This is a full-time onsite position with a schedule of Monday-Friday, 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM.

What We Offer


 * Competitive Compensation: $55,000 - $65,000 annually, based on experience.
 * Comprehensive Benefits:
 * Medical insurance options with zero deductible
 * Vision and dental coverage
 * 401(k) plan
 * Generous PTO policy
 * Career Growth Opportunities: Be part of a company on the cutting edge of IT innovation.
   
   

Additional Notes


 * Training will occur in Chappaqua, NY, with anticipated travel to the Chappaqua School District as needed.
 * Fingerprinting and background checks may be required.
   
   

Our Culture

At Acture Solutions, respect, quality, and inclusiveness are core values. We foster a collaborative environment where team members are encouraged to achieve ambitious goals in a supportive and fun workplace.

Join Us

Step into a challenging yet rewarding role where your skills will directly impact educational success. If you are ready to grow with an innovative company, apply now!

Note: A valid driver's license is required for this position.

A criminal background check and having a valid drivers license are requirements for this position.

description:

Location: Remote

We are currently seeking candidates who meet the following qualifications:

Key Responsibilities


 * Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support database systems and data warehouses.
 * Analyze business requirements, data sources, and existing database systems to create models that meet business and technical needs.
 * Work closely with business analysts, data architects, and developers to ensure alignment between data models and business goals.

Requirements


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
 * Proven experience as a Data Modeler or similar role, with a strong portfolio of implemented data models.
 * Hands-on experience with relational (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra).

title: Data Modeler

description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Senior Analyst - Content Insights

At PlayStation, we are passionate about creating a vibrant and inclusive gaming community that inspires creativity, connection, and joy. As a part of Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE), we are committed to building innovative, world-class experiences for millions of players around the globe.

We are looking for a collaborative, data-driven, and forward-thinking Senior Analyst to join our PlayStation Services team. This team is part of the Global Marketing, Sales, and Business Operations (GMSBO) organization, which drives the PlayStation Plus subscription business—a key driver of growth and innovation at Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Role Overview

As a Senior Analyst, you will be at the intersection of data, strategy, and innovation, using your analytical skills to influence the content and benefits offered to PlayStation Plus members. Your work will directly impact the experiences we provide to our global gaming community, ensuring they feel valued and engaged. This is an exciting opportunity to combine your technical expertise, strategic mindset, and passion for entertainment to help shape the future of our subscription services.

What You’ll Do


 * Leverage internal and external data sources, including commercial, behavioral, and consumer insights data, to build predictive models for engagement, performance, and revenue.
 * Use tools like SQL, Python, Airflow, Tableau, and Domo to scale the delivery and usability of data across the Services team.
 * Provide data-driven recommendations on how content and benefits can drive engagement and grow subscription sales.
 * Partner with cross-functional teams within GMSBO and across SIE to translate complex data into actionable insights.
 * Collaborate with global teams to ensure your findings are integrated into broader business strategies and decision-making processes.
 * Contribute to the development of scalable tools and methodologies that enhance content performance analysis and forecasting.
   
   

Who You Are

We value team members from all backgrounds who bring their unique perspectives and skills to the table. Our ideal candidate is:


 * Technically Proficient: Skilled in SQL, Python, and visualization tools like Tableau or Domo.
 * Insightful: Adept at transforming complex data into meaningful, actionable insights.
 * Collaborative: Thrives in team settings, building strong relationships across diverse groups and geographies.
 * Organized: Able to juggle multiple priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment.
 * Communicative: Strong verbal and written communication skills, capable of engaging stakeholders at all levels.
 * Detail-Oriented: Precise and meticulous in your work, with a commitment to high-quality outputs.
   
   

Basic Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or computational field.
 * 4+ years of experience in an analytics role within the digital entertainment space.
 * Proven ability to deliver end-to-end analytical insights from ambiguous business challenges.
 * Experience building and modeling data assets, creating visualizations, and delivering impactful reports.
 * Flexibility to support global business operations, including varying work hours.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Passion for gaming and an interest in the gaming industry’s trends and innovations.
 * Experience working with subscription-based businesses.
 * Familiarity with AI tools and their applications in analytics.
 * Advanced degree in a relevant field.
 * PlayStation fan a plus
   
   

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for SIE’s top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package. Click here to learn more.

The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.

$161,100—$241,700 USD
