Job Details

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Intelligence Lead specializing in PowerBI to join our team in the Healthcare industry. This is a unique opportunity for a motivated individual to play a pivotal role in transforming our business operations by leveraging data and analytics. The Business Intelligence Lead will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our business intelligence capabilities. This role requires a deep understanding of data management (e.g., permissions, recovery, security, monitoring), data warehousing, report writing, and delivering business intelligence insights to the team.

Responsibilities


 * Lead the development and execution of the company's business intelligence strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
 * Design, develop, and implement business intelligence dashboards and reports using PowerBI to provide insights and support decision-making processes.
 * Manage the full lifecycle of BI projects, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
 * Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
 * Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
 * Evaluate and preprocess raw information to ensure accuracy and reliability.
 * Use SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API to manage and manipulate data, including data extraction, storage, transformation, and loading.
 * Maintain and ensure data privacy and compliance according to industry standards and regulations.
 * Conduct training sessions to educate end-users on the utilization of BI tools and dashboards.
 * Stay current with industry trends and developments in BI and healthcare to ensure the company's BI capabilities are cutting-edge.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in a business intelligence role, preferably in the healthcare industry.
 * Proven experience with BI technologies, specifically PowerBI.
 * Strong knowledge of SQL, SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API.
 * Experience in data warehouse design and data mining.
 * Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution, etc.)
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
 * Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations related to data privacy and management.
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
   
   

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business results and have a proven track record in business intelligence, we would love to hear from you. Join us and help shape the future of our organization with your expertise.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Seramount, Fair360 and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Data Analyst Manager to join our National Audit Technology organization.

Responsibilities:


 * Collect, analyze, and interpret data to identify trends, patterns, and insights; assist teams in researching, understanding, acquiring, and properly utilizing data assets
 * Cleanse, validate, and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency; develop and maintain data flow diagrams, data models, dashboards, and reports to support business decision-making
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide data-driven recommendations; conduct ad-hoc data analysis and provide insights to answer specific business questions
 * Identify data quality issues and work with data owners to resolve them; perform statistical analysis and data mining to uncover actionable insights; present findings and visualizations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
 * Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis; improve data analysis processes and techniques continuously
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Minimum five years of recent experience in data analysis or related role
 * Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in a relevant field such as mathematics, statistics, economics, or computer science is preferred
 * Proficiency in data preparation, analysis tools and programming languages, such as Alteryx, SQL, Python, R, or Excel; solid analytical and problem-solving skills; strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity
 * Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView; knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and methodologies (200TEC)

title: Manager, Data Analyst

description:
INTUITIVE® is a nationally recognized Best Place to Work that provides solutions from design through production to sustainment by delivering targeted results. Our approach couples the latest technology with engineering expertise and analytical proficiency while remaining true to genuine customer relationships and a culture that fosters growth and opportunity. Our diverse portfolio of capabilities and extensive customer base allows our employees countless opportunities to pursue their passions and support our nation’s Warfighters. Join our team that encourages creativity, welcomes initiative, and seeks excellence. Start Building Your Future today!

Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to directly support our government customer. In this role, you will be responsible for establishing, implementing, and managing measures and metrics within the organization. You will serve as the authority on data evaluation and analysis, providing expert guidance to develop high-priority analyses and metrics. You will work closely with various teams and stakeholders to identify areas for study, develop data collection formats, and ensure accurate and reliable data. Key responsibilities may include:


 * Conduct analysis of industry standards for measuring and applying metrics to programs and technical products and services.
 * Develop approaches to gather necessary information and data regarding products and services and implement these approaches.
 * Extract, compile, and analyze information from multiple sources to establish baseline measures and determine overall effectiveness and efficiency of programs, products, and services.
 * Utilize predictive modeling and advanced statistical analysis to translate aggregate program, product, and service metrics into actionable business intelligence for decision making.
 * Identify, design, and maintain key performance indicators, and present findings in an easily understood and professional formal
 * Implement predictive modeling and advanced statistical analysis processes to facilitate business decision making.
 * Build internal relationships with key program, product, and service delivery managers to define crucial business objectives and customer information product needs and requirements.
 * Develop sophisticated approaches to develop and collect internal and external data regarding the delivery of products and services.
 * Apply objective, analytical, and critical thinking to the analysis of complex problems using a full suite of analytic tools and techniques.
 * Conduct ongoing analysis and evaluation of business needs and functional requirements necessary for gathering and reporting data.
 * Coordinate with the metrics team to develop standardized data collection formats and database queries for ongoing data collection and analysis.
 * Remain current with industry standards and practices for measuring and applying metrics, maintaining a cognizance of predictive modeling and statistical analysis.
 * Develop courses of action and establish standard operating procedures for developing new studies.
   
   
   

Required


 * BS or BA degree
 * Minimum of 10 years' experience with process improvement/development
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Microsoft SharePoint
 * Experience with Power BI or other data analytics software tools
 * Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance
   
   
   

Disability Accommodation for Applicants - Intuitive Research and Technology Corporation is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in its job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the following alternative email address or phone number to contact us about your interest in employment at INTUITIVE hr@irtc-hq.com or 256-922-9300. Our process is to respond and to work with the requestor to identify a workable accommodation to the application process.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst for ProMach’s Systems & Process business unit. This group encompasses 21 go-to-market brands and offers a diverse range of equipment and services for processing and packaging machinery production lines. The business unit's offerings include processing and packaging integration and engineering services, digital intelligence, conveyor systems, sterilization systems, tray packaging, flow wrapping, pouch packaging, and more.

Key Responsibilities Of This Role Include…


 * Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to uncover industry trends, market opportunities, customer behaviors, and emerging technologies. Evaluate market size, growth potential, and market share to inform strategic decisions.
 * Competitive Analysis: Track and analyze competitor activities, including product offerings, pricing strategies, marketing campaigns, financial performance, and strategic initiatives. Create detailed competitor profiles and benchmarking reports to support competitive positioning.
 * Business Strategy Insight: Provide insights into the overall business strategy by identifying critical questions and performing ad-hoc analyses.
 * Marketing Strategy Support: Collaborate with marketing teams to provide data-driven insights for campaign development and execution. Evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and suggest improvements.
 * Insights Communication: Prepare comprehensive reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings and insights to brand teams, including technical and non-technical audiences.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to support business objectives and align intelligence efforts with business goals
   
   

Who we’re looking for?


 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Data Science
 * Three (3) to Five (5) years in a similar role, preferably in manufacturing or consumer packaged goods industries
 * Prior experience using Salesforce, preferred, or a similar tool to create dashboards and projects
 * Proven ability to utilize Project Management principles to run multiple tasks concurrently under aggressive timelines in a dynamic environment
 * Proven familiarity with strategic tools to produce data models
 * Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, across a broad scope of technological capability
   
   

What’s in it for you?

There's no monopoly on innovative ideas or limits to how far you can advance with our team. We offer an open, communicative environment that fosters individual initiative. We pride ourselves in being a company where people are happy and choose to build a career.

In addition to growth opportunities, as a ProMach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your salary, comprehensive medical/dental programs, as well as life insurance, a generous paid time off program, and a retirement savings plan with a company match. And because we understand the importance of feeling protected, there is no waiting period for benefits – you are eligible on your first day of employment!

Pro Mach, Inc. was named to the Inc. 5,000 list of the fastest growing private companies in the U.S. seven times. We continue to introduce innovative products, enter new markets, expand our global presence, and actively acquire new capabilities.

Curious about life at ProMach? Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram!

ProMach is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pro Mach uses E-Verify to verify employment eligibility of all new hires to work in the United States. Pro Mach is a drug-free workplace.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

description:
Description - External

The purpose of the ESG Reporting & Disclosures Analyst is to develop submissions for ESG ratings and rankings, which our clients, investors and external stakeholders expect, including EcoVadis, CDP, WME, Sustainalytics, MSCI and ISS. Monitors for new reporting trends and regulatory updates around ESG disclosures.

Details

Making an Impact

• Manage the annual submissions for ESG ratings, including CDP and EcoVadis, and reviews data for investor ratings and rankings, including MSCI, ISS and Sustainalytics.

• Monitor regulatory trends around ESG disclosures, including SEC, CSRD and ISSB reporting for country-level requirements and share recommendations on how to align our ESG reporting with best practice frameworks, including ISSB, SASB, TCFD, GRI and SCM

• Support country-level EcoVadis submissions by sharing global best practices

Sharing Expertise

• Aid in the developing our ESG reporting space – including frameworks like TCFD, SASB and GRI

• Monitor and share knowledge with internal teams around the fast-moving landscape of ESG reporting requirements and regulations

• Provide clients and stakeholders with reporting of our ESG data

Gaining Exposure

• There are strong internal communities already developed (ie. ESG and Planet leaders) so the role does not require existing internal stakeholder networks

Your Typical Day

• Prepare submissions for ESG ratings and rankings, including developing a gap analysis and gathering data from various internal stakeholders to populate the questionnaire(s)

• Consult with functional and country-level teams on questions related to EcoVadis, climate roadmaps or ESG reporting, providing advice and guidance to enhance disclosures

• Work with controller function to improve data quality, prepare for third-party assurance and embed data in mandatory reporting

Manage requests from clients or sales leaders on ESG topics

Other accountabilities as assigned




Qualifications - External

Required

• Education: Bachelor’s degree

• Minimum 3 years work experience

• Working knowledge of ESG, corporate responsibility and sustainability best practices, including raters and rankers such as ISS, MSCI, DJSI, Sustainalytics and ESG reporting frameworks including GRI and SASB

• 2+ years of project management experience and/or strong organizational skills

Nice to Have

• Strong written, oral, and presentation skills

• Ability to influence without direct reporting structure at all levels

title: ESG Reporting & Disclosures Analyst

description:
The successful applicant will work as part of a team responsible for analyzing health plan costs and utilization trends, quality of care (process and outcomes measures), efficiency and practice pattern variation, and other relevant performance metrics. The position will also provide statistical support to general R&D and Medical Affairs projects as needed.

This professional can work in a 100% remote capacity and must be located in the US.


 * Analyze health plan performance in terms of costs and clinical effectiveness versus benchmarks
 * Develops methods for consistency and validity checking to assure accurate results
 * Maintains data management process documentation as part of routine QA.
 * Write analysis plans and portions of methods and results sections for manuscripts and reports
 * Contribute to improved report design by working with users to identify reporting needs
 * Gather and prepare data for analysis by others
 * Prepare timely, accurate ad hoc reports and updates to periodic reports.
   
   

Required Work Experience


 * 2+ years of business experience
 * Master's degree in statistics or biostatistics.
 * Experience with basic statistical procedures including chi-square tests, t-tests, generalized linear models
 * Experience analyzing data, ideally healthcare claims data or health outcome data
   
   

Preferred Work Experience


 * Familiarity with common database structures and query languages such as SQL, SAS, and/or other similar analytical programs
   
   

Physical And Mental Requirements


 * Able to sit and work at a computer keyboard for extended periods of time.
 * Able to stoop, kneel, bend at the waist and reach on a daily basis.
 * Able to perform general office administrative activities: copying, filing, delivering and using the telephone.
 * Able to lift up to 25 pounds occasionally
   
   

Knowledge


 * Understands the concepts of non-parametric statistics, model selections, survival analysis
   
   

Skills


 * Proficient in Microsoft, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
 * Proficient in either R or SAS, both preferred
   
   

Competencies


 * Keen attention to detail
 * Strong critical thinking, analytic and problem-solving skills
 * Excellent organizational skills
 * Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
 * Self-motivated
 * Customer focused
 * Team player
 * Willing to check the work of other analysts and to courteously point out potential problems
 * Willing to have his or her own work checked by other analysts and to graciously consider their suggestions
 * Adaptable
 * Responsible
 * Committed to excellence
 * Continuous learning-oriented
 * Exhibits a personal presence characterized by honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others.
 * Knows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and company values in behaviors, practices and decisions.

title: Health Data Analyst/Statistician (Remote)

description:
About Us

Spellman High Voltage Electronics Corporation, a family owned business for over 75 years, takes pride in powering progress in health, security and quality of life. We are key partners with the world’s leading medical devices, semiconductor, scientific analytics and industrial systems manufacturers. When they want to push the limits of what’s possible with high voltage applications, they turn to us to make it happen.

While Spellman is not a household name, our products are used to make and often power many of the most advanced technologies that make modern life possible. With design and manufacturing sites in North America, Europe and Asia, we have become the preferred provider of high voltage power solutions for OEMs pushing the boundaries of technology around the world by designing and producing the products they need to power progress.

Data Analysts must work with cross functional teams to develop a collection method for pertinent data. Once data is being collected, the Analyst must vet the data to ensure it’s accuracy and consistency. The Analyst is expected to review the data, and present it in a form that allows for summarized review for the purpose of making data driven business decisions. The Analyst needs to be able to map the source of the data and develop a plan ton monitor data to ensure integrity long term where applicable

The Data Analyst position reports to Quality but will often be engaged with other departments and cross functional teams as data is needed for continuous improvement and operation excellence.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


 * Analyze data and translate it into meaningful information
 * Vet data and extrapolate data pattens and trends
 * Sanitize data to ensure to removal of outliers or erroneous data
 * Monitor and maintain data integrity
 * Validate data collection processes.
 * Develop rules and methodologies for effective data management
 * Present concise consistent data and actionable conclusions in easily understood charts, graphs, or spreadsheets.
 * Answer questions concerning results
 * Document existing data development processes
 * Develop a global data management and analysis plan to ensure data collection and reporting is standardized and consistent across sited allowing management to strategically drive issues to closure and promote continuous improvement.
 * Develop, articulate, and implement new ideas and systems that will streamline and simplify data collection and dissemination of information.
   
   

What You Need:


 * 4+ years in manufacturing
 * 2+ years of Lean Manufacturing and/or 6 Sigma experience
 * Ability to lead a cross functional team through Lean projects
 * Computer literate in MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Projects
 * BS in science field with training in statistical analysis and data mining
 * Experience in sorting and analyzing field data
 * String analytical skills
 * Strong skills in the use of MS Excel, Pivot tables, and other data analysis software
 * Will need to learn to use Power Bi
 * Ability to process information logically
 * String oral and written communication skills, including the ability to clearly communicate data limitations and deadlines, as will as present findings to management and colleagues
 * Ability to thrive in a fast paced, fluid, and technical organization
 * Ability to balance competing priorities and concurrent projects
 * Will need to learn basic functions, including presentation, through Teams Software.
   
   

Our good faith estimate of the salary range for this role is $59,724.00 - $76,259.00. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and other factors. In addition to base pay, we offer a full benefits package

Spellman takes safety seriously. All new hires are required to provide proof of COVID vaccination at start, or must request and be granted a religious or medical exemption.

We at Spellman High Voltage Electronics Corporation believe that each individual is entitled to equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, creed, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status or disability. The right of equal employment opportunity extends to recruiting, hiring selection, transfer, promotion, training and all other conditions of employment. To request accommodation related to disabilities, please email us at careers@spellmanhv.com, or call +1 (631) 630-3000

Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Spellman High Voltage Electronics does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Spellman High Voltage Electronics employee. Spellman High Voltage Electronics will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Spellman High Voltage Electronics and will be processed accordingly.

title: Entry Level Business/Data Analyst

description:
Location: US

Contract Type: Long-term

Data Meaning is a front-runner in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics consulting, renowned for our high-quality consulting services throughout the US and LATAM. Our expertise lies in delivering tailored solutions in Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, and Project Management. We are dedicated to bringing premier services to our diverse clientele. We have a global team of 95+ consultants, all working remotely, embodying a collaborative, inclusive, and innovation-driven work culture.

Overview:

The ideal candidate will have at least 10 years of experience, including a proven track record in a leadership role managing technical teams and delivering data visualization projects. Also demonstrate expertise in modern data visualization tools and technologies, the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights, and a strong capacity to lead end-to-end BI and reporting solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives.

Responsibilities:


 * Lead and Manage Data Visualization Projects: oversee end-to-end delivery of data visualization solutions, from requirements gathering to deployment, ensuring alignment with business goals
 * Team Leadership and Mentorship: guide and mentor a team of BI developers and analysts, fostering growth and ensuring high-quality deliverables
 * Design and Develop Visualizations: create clear, impactful, and user-friendly dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker to translate complex data into actionable insights
 * Collaboration with Stakeholders: work closely with business leaders, data engineers, and analysts to understand business needs and provide effective visualization solutions
 * Ensure Data Accuracy and Quality: Verify data consistency, accuracy, and completeness across all visualizations, implementing best practices for data governance
 * Drive Best Practices for Visualization Standards: Establish and enforce design principles, storytelling techniques, and visualization best practices for clarity and consistency
 * Performance Optimization: Optimize dashboards and reporting tools for speed and efficiency, ensuring an excellent user experience
 * Project Planning and Prioritization: Manage project timelines, priorities, and resource allocation to meet business objectives and deadlines
 * Advocate for Data-Driven Culture: Promote data literacy within the organization, empowering teams to make informed decisions through well-designed visual tools
   
   

Requirements:


 * 10+ years of experience in data visualization, business intelligence, or analytics, with at least 3+ years in a leadership role
 * Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar platforms
 * Strong understanding of data modeling concepts, including relational databases, data warehousing, and ETL pipelines
 * Experience with SQL for querying and transforming data across large datasets
 * Excellent analytical and storytelling skills to transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights
 * Experience managing and mentoring teams, with strong leadership and project management abilities
 * Familiarity with modern cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and integrating data sources into visualization tools
 * Knowledge of design principles and UX best practices to deliver intuitive, user-friendly dashboards and reports
 * Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including stakeholders, data engineers, and analysts
 * Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written to present insights and recommendations effectively
 * Experience with Agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA or Trello for project management
 * Continuous learning mindset with a passion for staying up to date on data visualization trends, tools, and technologies

Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”.

Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA:

https://kpmg.com/us/en/how-we-work/pay-transparency.html/?id=5625_9_25

KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

KPMG does not currently require partners or employees to be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to KPMG offices, client sites or KPMG events, except when mandated by federal, state or local law. In some circumstances, clients also may require proof of vaccination or testing (e.g., to go to the client site).

KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them.

title: Manager, Data Analyst

description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data-driven insights to shape strategic initiatives and drive organizational growth? AMSOIL is looking for a technical and strategic-minded Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. We're seeking an individual with a keen focus on artificial intelligence to drive operational efficiency and decision-making through advanced analytics and AI integration. Our ideal candidate is passionate about uncovering valuable data insights and possesses a strong drive to utilize technology for automating and streamlining processes within the organization. This position offers a hybrid work schedule requiring a minimum of 2 days a week in the office located in Superior, Wisconsin.

Core Responsibilities:


 * Collaborate with Stakeholders to understand their business information needs and formulate data-driven solutions.
 * Working with department leaders to assess opportunities for AI integration to enhance operations, automate processes, and improve overall employee productivity.
 * Participate in the development efforts designed to create solutions and tools to collect, process, analyze and disseminate reliable, actionable information to the organization.
 * Design, develop, and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc., that support our analytical and business needs.
 * Use advanced analytics techniques to gather and analyze large datasets to solve complex problems and provide actionable insights.
 * Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing quality controls and validation processes.
 * Define and design secure in-house AI models and algorithms to analyze data, automate processes, enhance productivity, and support strategic initiatives.
 * Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in BI and AI technologies, applying this knowledge to enhance data analysis and the decision-making processes.
 * Drive continuous improvement by seeking feedback, analyzing performance metrics, and identifying areas for optimization.
   
   

Position Requirements:


 * Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, statistics, business analysis, or equivalent work experience.
 * 5 or more years of experience as a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, with a strong focus on analytics and problem-solving.
 * Skilled in using R, Python or SQL to manipulate data and create actionable insights from large data sets.
 * Proficiency with data visualization tools and BI/AI platforms (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Microsoft BI Stack, ChatGPT, and MS Copilot).
 * Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, reports, and charts.
   
   

Preferred Requirements:


 * Proficiency in data warehouse analysis and MS SQL Server development, including ETL processes (SSIS), reporting tools (SSRS), analysis cubes (SSAS), stored procedures, views, triggers, functions, and query optimization.
 * Experience with predictive models, machine-learning algorithms, and AI language models.
   
   

Benefits:


 * Paid time off and paid holidays each year
 * Employee bonus program
 * 401(k) with company match
 * Paid life, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance
 * Competitive health benefits
 * Health savings account (HSA) and flexible spending account (FSA) options
 * Affordable group dental, vision, critical illness, and accident insurance
 * Employee discount on product
 * Corporate gym membership
   
   

If you have any questions or need assistance with the application process, please email: humanresources@amsoil.com

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

AMSOIL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions on employment and promotion are based on merit, qualifications, performance and business needs. The decisions and criteria governing the employment relationship with all employees are made in a nondiscriminatory manner, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status or any other factor determined to be unlawful by federal, state or local statutes.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
We seek a Senior Data Analyst/Engineer with expertise in data modeling, analytics, and ETL processes to join our team. The ideal candidate will have significant experience with data modeling for analytic services, working with tabular and multidimensional models, and troubleshooting complex data warehouse and reporting system issues. This role requires a deep understanding of cloud-based data analytics services, particularly within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, and a strong background in data integration, reporting, and optimizing data workflows.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Design, develop, and manage tabular and multidimensional data models for analytic services, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
 * Troubleshoot and analyze data warehouse and report system issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions.
 * Write complex SQL queries to extract and manage large datasets, ensuring efficient data retrieval.
 * Using tools like Power BI or Tableau, develop interactive visual reports and dashboards with filters, variables, and drill-down capabilities.
 * Design and manage ETL processes, ensuring seamless data integration from on-premises and cloud-based sources.
 * Schedule and automate ongoing data processing jobs to ensure reliable data pipelines.
 * Optimize data processing workflows for improved performance and reliability.
 * Ensure data security through role-based access control (RBAC), encryption, and industry standards (e.g., HIPAA) compliance.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design scalable data solutions that meet growing data volumes and user demands.
 * Document technical processes, data models, and system configurations for development and operational purposes.
 * Implement high availability and disaster recovery processes to ensure business continuity.
 * Optimize resource usage and cost efficiency in cloud-based data solutions.
 * Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and analytics.
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Extensive experience with data warehouse modeling and development, including experience with both tabular and multidimensional models.
 * Strong understanding of Microsoft Azure services, particularly Azure Data Warehouse (DW), Azure Data Factory, and other Azure analytics services.
 * Experience writing complex queries in SQL Server and Oracle to manage large-scale datasets.
 * Hands-on experience with Power BI, SSRS, Tableau, and similar visualization tools for creating interactive reports and dashboards.
 * Familiarity with Python or other scripting languages for data manipulation and automation.
 * Strong understanding of data security measures, including encryption and role-based access control (RBAC).
 * Knowledge of industry data compliance regulations, such as HIPAA.
 * Ability to design scalable data solutions that handle large data volumes and user demand.
 * Experience with process optimization, including improving data models' and ETL workflows' performance and reliability.
 * Good understanding of high availability and disaster recovery concepts.
 * Experience with issue tracking and project management tools like Jira and familiarity with Agile software development methodologies.
 * Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively across teams.
 * Ability to maintain and create technical documentation for both development and operational purposes.
   
   
   

Desired Skills:


 * Experience with machine learning techniques and their integration into data analytics workflows.
 * Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Microsoft Solutions Developer, Oracle, Google Cloud, etc.) that demonstrate expertise in data analytics and cloud technologies.
 * Experience with ERWIN or similar data modeling tools for database design and structure.
   
   
   

Salary Range: $120,000 - $160,000 per year

Flexible work from home options available.
title: Data Analyst/Engineer – Data Modeling & Analytics

description:
Position: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: Andover, MA (Hybrid – 3 days onsite)

Length: 6-12 months

*W2 Candidates Only




Job Description:

Our client is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior BI Analyst to join their team. As the Senior BI Analyst, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, reporting, and business intelligence tools to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable insights, uncover trends to support strategic initiatives, and optimize processes for enhanced efficiency and growth. You will lead projects, mentor junior analysts, and utilize cutting-edge BI platforms and data technologies in a dynamic manufacturing context.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities (but not limited to):

 * Collaborate with business teams to define reporting requirements and translate them into actionable data insights.
 * Design, develop, and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to support decision-making.
 * Monitor and refine reporting solutions for accuracy and relevance.
 * Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, and provide statistical insights to drive strategic decisions.
 * Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and governance, working with IT and data teams to optimize infrastructure.
 * Manage analytics projects from concept to implementation, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
 * Present data-driven insights to senior management and stakeholders.
 * Mentor junior analysts, advocate for BI tools, and drive innovation in analytics processes.
 * Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations.




Qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.
 * 7+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a similar role with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights.
 * Experience with Power BI, strong experience with SQL and data warehousing skills.
 * Expertise in extracting, manipulating, visualizing, and modeling large datasets.
 * In-depth knowledge of data warehousing and Lakehouse concepts, ETL processes, and related technologies utilizing Microsoft Synapse Analytics and Databricks.
 * Advanced proficiency in Excel.
 * Experience working with Azure-based data platforms.
 * Must possess a strong business acumen with the ability to determine business needs and putting it into practice.
 * Experience managing multiple projects and familiarity with Agile methodologies.
 * A commitment to continuous improvement, innovation, and driving business performance through data insights.

description:
Job Title: Quantitative Researcher – High-Frequency Trading




Location: New York, NY




About the Firm:

Join one of the most prestigious high-frequency trading firms, renowned for its cutting-edge technology, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation. This firm leverages advanced research, machine learning, and proprietary algorithms to remain at the forefront of the financial markets.




Role Overview:

We are seeking exceptional Quantitative Researchers to join our elite team in New York. In this role, you will design, develop, and optimize high-frequency trading strategies across various asset classes. Working in close collaboration with traders, engineers, and fellow researchers, you will analyze vast datasets, uncover market inefficiencies, and deploy strategies in a fast-paced, competitive environment.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Conduct data-driven research to identify statistical patterns and market inefficiencies.
 * Develop and implement high-frequency trading strategies in global markets.
 * Utilize advanced mathematical models and machine learning techniques to optimize trading performance.
 * Collaborate with engineers to refine execution algorithms and ensure low-latency performance.
 * Continuously monitor and evaluate strategy performance, making real-time adjustments as necessary.
 * Stay at the forefront of industry developments, including new datasets, technologies, and market structure changes.




Qualifications:

 * Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
 * Strong programming skills in Python, C++, or other relevant languages.
 * Deep understanding of probability, statistics, and optimization.
 * Experience with machine learning techniques and large-scale data analysis.
 * Familiarity with financial markets and trading strategies (preferred but not required).
 * Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, detail-oriented mindset.
 * Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Why Join Us?

 * Work with some of the brightest minds in finance and technology.
 * Access to unparalleled resources, including state-of-the-art technology and datasets.
 * Competitive compensation package with performance-based bonuses.
 * Opportunities for growth and development in a collaborative, meritocratic environment.
title: Quantitative Researcher

description:
About Vheda Health

Vheda Health is a leader in virtual health engagement, dedicated to improving health equity for underserved populations. With over 10 years of experience and a strong national presence, our turnkey chronic care coordination programs provide simple access to care coordination from anywhere, helping health plans deliver better outcomes for their members.

We"re Hiring a Data and Strategy Analyst to Join Our Team!

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make a meaningful impact on health equity? Join Vheda Health as a Data and Strategy Analyst! This advanced entry-level role is tailored for recent graduates with a master's degree. It combines analytical skills, strategic thinking, and cross-functional collaboration to support data-driven decision-making and compliance initiatives. This is your opportunity to contribute to impactful projects, grow professionally, and work alongside senior leadership.

Key Responsibilities

Advanced Data Analysis


 * Perform in-depth data collection, analysis, and interpretation to address business challenges and enhance organizational decision-making.
 * Create comprehensive reports, dashboards, and presentations for leadership and stakeholders.
 * Leverage statistical models and predictive analytics to identify trends and opportunities.
   
   

Strategic Planning and Implementation


 * Collaborate with senior leaders to develop and implement strategic initiatives.
 * Analyze organizational goals and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
 * Support project teams by ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and compliance standards.
   
   

Compliance and Policy Monitoring


 * Gather data and support compliance reviews to ensure adherence to policies.
 * Document processes and recommend improvements to strengthen compliance efforts.
 * Assist in audits and prepare reports to highlight key findings and recommendations.
   
   

Cross-Functional Collaboration


 * Partner with teams across the organization to contribute to interdisciplinary projects.
 * Engage with leadership on high-priority tasks and provide data-backed solutions.
 * Bridge the gap between data insights and actionable business strategies.
   
   

Continuous Learning and Development


 * Stay updated on industry trends, analytical tools, and methodologies.
 * Participate in advanced training programs and leadership workshops.
 * Demonstrate initiative by proposing innovative ideas and solutions.
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * Master"s or Bachelor"s degree in data analytics, business intelligence, computer science, or a related field.
 * Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
 * Strong analytical and statistical capabilities.
 * Experience in healthcare compliance, including knowledge of regulatory requirements, HIPAA compliance, and healthcare quality measures.
 * Proven track record in project management and implementation, demonstrating ability to lead cross-functional initiatives from planning through execution.
 * Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
 * Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
 * Demonstrated leadership potential and a collaborative mindset.
 * Six Sigma certification, preferred.
 * AI experience, preferred.
   
   

What We Offer


 * Exposure to high-impact projects and opportunities to present findings to senior leadership.
 * A clear pathway for career growth, with mentorship and advanced training programs.
 * A dynamic, innovative, and collaborative work environment.
   
   

Vheda Health Benefits


 * Competitive salary
 * Comprehensive health Insurance including medical, dental, vision, LTD, STD and life insurance
 * 401(k)
 * Unlimited paid time off
 * 11 paid company holidays
 * Engaging team events

title: Data and Strategy Analyst

description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

Dealing with health plan data and specific medical issues and trends can be unfamiliar territory for Meritain Health's clients. In collaboration with Meritain's Client Solution Team, leveraging Tableau as well as our analytics tool Enlight, Informatics focuses on translating data into comprehensive insights and actionable results for our employers.


 * Proactively offer insights on client plan performance with a focus of turning data into actionable information.
 * Effectively communicate and collaborate across departments to manage client and broker requests for your block of business.
 * Become a subject matter expert for Client Management, clients and brokers related to our Enlight tool and their client's data.
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * We support a hybrid work environment. If selected and you live near a suitable work location, you may be expected to comply with the hybrid work policy. Under the policy, all hires for in-scope populations should be placed into a hybrid or office-based location, working onsite three days a week. Aetna Service Operations office/hub locations will be discussed with the selected candidate.
 * 1+ years of data analysis experience and beginning to intermediate Tableau skills
 * 1 year of experience working with Tableau for data visualization and analytics.
 * 2 years experience with Microsoft Suite: Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
 * Experience in statistical analysis and database management. Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Understanding of relational databases, data systems and data warehouses.
 * Proven track record of consulting and advising internal/external clients on data decision making
 * Excellent Verbal and written communication presenting complex data and recommendations to clients
    * Ability to translate business needs to a non- technical audience
      

Preferred Qualifications


 * 1 year Project Management experience.
 * Medical coding experience.
 * Knowledge of healthcare industry preferred.
 * 1 Year working with Health Care Insurance, primarily with Self-Funded claims with an understanding of data sources and categories.
 * A variety of experience with analytics tools.- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
 * Self-motivated with the Ability to work independently without direction, and ability to prioritize work effectively.
   
   

Education


 * Bachelor's or equivalent experience.
   
   

Pay Range

The Typical Pay Range For This Role Is

$43,888.00 - $102,081.60

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit Benefits | CVS Health

title: Data Analytics Consultant

companyName: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
description:
The DSS Accountability Office’s ORCA is charged with working closely with internal and external partners to ensure that DHS facilities, directly-managed and those managed by provider agencies, comply with statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations governing the provision of shelter in New York City. ORCA carries out its mission through collaboration with Agency personnel to develop initiatives that optimize the Agency’s resources to comply with regulatory requirements.

The Office Of Regulatory Compliance & Accountability (ORCA) Is Recruiting For (1) One City Research Scientist II To Function As a Data Research Analyst, Who Will


 * Provide analytical support in the areas of data reporting, data analysis, and internal audits for special projects created and designed to enhance the operational and administrative activities of HRA regarding program accountability and integrity.
 * Assume responsibility for all aspects of project management and data analysis regarding integrity concerns, including the research and development of innovative methods of data mining that will identify integrity and fraud issues for all of HRA.
 * Conduct internal ad hoc inquiries into HRA's various source systems and analyzing quantitative I qualitative data to locate vulnerabilities within the agency; providing proposals and suggestions to improve HRA's overall accountability and integrity.
 * Assist with the creation and implementation of data mining for AO. Perform trend analysis and prepare reports on trends. Maintain consistency and integrity of data collection; report concerns regarding data integrity.
 * Provide analytical support to the Director ORCA and other program areas under the Accountability Office umbrella in the areas of data reporting, data analysis, and internal audits.
 * Understand and document project-specific source access mechanisms, detailed data flow and related transformation to specific targets. Assist with the design of alternative approaches for effective data integration.
   
   

Minimum Qualifications


 * For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.
   
   

To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:


 * A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or
 * A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or
 * Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.
   
   

Note

Probationary Period

Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.

Preferred Skills


 * Proficiency with a statistical software package such as R, SAS, Stata, MATLAB or SPSS. - Experience using Excel to clean, match, and analyze very large data sets. - Experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data from large databases. - Strong organizational skills. - Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. - Programming experience a plus.
   
   

Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Additional Information

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.
title: DATA RESEARCH ANALYST

description:
Job Description

The Data and Analytics department drives strategic and operational decisions for The Washington Post. This highly visible team applies analytics and insights to support strategic initiatives and day-to-day operational support company-wide and is currently seeking a Principal Data Analyst.

 

As our Principal Data Analyst, you’ll work in close collaboration with the professional products, client solutions, newsroom, growth, product, engineering, advertising and finance departments to shape the growth of WP Intelligence, our new professional products business. You will regularly interact with various stakeholders in these departments, understand needs, build reports, conduct data analysis, and make actionable recommendations. You will love solving open-ended problems by taking mountains of data, transforming them into meaningful analysis aimed at identifying solutions and opportunities. You are happiest in a role where you can solve problems where business, math, technology, and practical intuition converge.

Motivation


 * You want to help shape strategy for different products and teams by turning ambiguous questions into actionable answers
 * You enjoy the balance of both technical data-wrangling (writing queries, code) and engaging presentations (summarizing takeaways, visualizing data)
 * You have a knack for synthesizing different aspects of the business (finance, advertising, engineering, content) to make the more relevant recommendations to various teams
 * You find value in educating coworkers about different metrics, KPIs, and analytics tools
 * You think about the full picture of data, from tracking requirements to efficient processing to digestible reporting
 * You can say you enjoy working on multiple projects at one time.
 * You are energized by working on complex problems and sharing your results with others
 * You find meaning in supporting teammates and leading through example
   
   

Responsibilities


 * You will support the growth of WP Intelligence, our new professional products business, by transforming ambiguous questions into KPIs, consulting on data collection, shaping product development, and building assets for self-service
 * You work with Growth, Client Solutions, Sales, Product, and Engineering teams to ensure metrics are appropriately defined, implemented, and tested across our digital assets
 * You will design, build, and maintain key periodic reports, dashboards and analyses utilizing Redshift, Web Analytics tools (Google Analytics), Python, Tableau and related reporting and visualization tools
 * You will synthesize multiple data sources (web analytics data, sales data, marketing data, first party data, newsletter data, subscription data, live events data, and external platforms data) to create a holistic picture of our potential and existing customers
 * You will develop best practices and approaches to answer ad hoc questions on online user behavior, customer journeys, engagement, conversion data and multi-channel attribution
 * You will lead various testing and optimization efforts by performing in-depth and ad-hoc analysis of information to aid in decision making
 * You will prepare and present reports, analysis and presentations to various stakeholders including executives
 * You will design and implement self-service tooling solutions to allow stakeholders across the company to get accurate, relevant, and timely insights
 * Empower and assist other junior members in the team to inform and influence their data and insights deliverables
 * As a senior member of the analytics team, you will foster a culture of transparency, accountability, and communication
   
   

Requirements

Minimum Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s or master’s in data science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or related field
 * 5+ years of data analytics experience, with a strong preference for experience in web analytics
 * A strong quantitative, creative, and problem-solving mindset
 * Collect and manage project ideas, charters, project priorities, and project benefit. Ability to multitask, prioritize projects, and meet deadline
 * Strong analytical and communication skills
 * Expertise in relational and non-relational Database Systems, Advanced SQL and Microsoft Excel. Experience with MySQL on cloud or AWS Redshift
 * Expertise in Python data analysis packages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
 * Expertise in Tableau, Looker, R Shiny, D3 or other visualization/ reporting tools
 * Expertise in Big Data tools and distributed data/computing tools like Spark, Hadoop (or other big-data solutions), Map/Reduce, S3, Hive, etc.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Expertise with enterprise Web Analytics systems (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Google Tag Manager)
 * Experience with media/ publishing industry
 * Experience supporting tiered product offerings, or subscription/ membership services
 * Experience working closely with sales and client solutions teams
   
   

When you join The Post

When you join TWP, you are joining a mission to connect, inform, and enlighten those around the globe with the highest caliber, most trustworthy news and information. Our multicultural, multi-generational workforce is constantly creating and innovating, leading the media and technology industries to better solutions. We welcome all perspectives and celebrate diverse backgrounds.

Whether you contribute to journalism, engineering, finance, or marketing, you are helping define the future of news.

We continue to shine a light into the darkness and hope you’ll join us.

Compensation And Benefits

Wherever you are in your life or career, The Washington Post offers comprehensive and inclusive benefits for every step of your journey:


 * Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage
 * Company-paid pension and 401(k) match
 * Three weeks of vacation and up to three weeks of paid sick leave
 * Nine paid holidays and two personal days
 * 20 weeks paid parental leave for any new parent
 * Robust mental health resources
 * Backup care and caregiver concierge services
 * Gender affirming services
 * Pet insurance
 * Free Post digital subscription
 * Leadership and career development programs
   
   

Benefits may vary based on the job, full-time or part-time schedule, location, and collectively bargained status.

The salary range for this position is:

98,800.00 - 164,600.00 USD Annual

The actual salary within this range will depend on individual skills, experience, and qualifications as they relate to specific job requirements. This position may be eligible for a bonus or incentive program, and a member of the Talent Acquisition team will discuss bonus payment terms and conditions during the interview process.

The Post strives to provide its readers with high-quality, trustworthy news and information while constantly innovating. That mission is best served by a diverse, multi-generational workforce with varied life experiences and perspectives. All cultures and backgrounds are welcomed.

The innovation doesn’t end in the Newsroom – dozens of teams power The Washington Post. We are now hiring the next innovator – how will you Impact Tomorrow?

Job Details

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Intelligence Lead specializing in PowerBI to join our team in the Healthcare industry. This is a unique opportunity for a motivated individual to play a pivotal role in transforming our business operations by leveraging data and analytics. The Business Intelligence Lead will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our business intelligence capabilities. This role requires a deep understanding of data management (e.g., permissions, recovery, security, monitoring), data warehousing, report writing, and delivering business intelligence insights to the team.

Responsibilities


 * Lead the development and execution of the company's business intelligence strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
 * Design, develop, and implement business intelligence dashboards and reports using PowerBI to provide insights and support decision-making processes.
 * Manage the full lifecycle of BI projects, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
 * Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
 * Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
 * Evaluate and preprocess raw information to ensure accuracy and reliability.
 * Use SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API to manage and manipulate data, including data extraction, storage, transformation, and loading.
 * Maintain and ensure data privacy and compliance according to industry standards and regulations.
 * Conduct training sessions to educate end-users on the utilization of BI tools and dashboards.
 * Stay current with industry trends and developments in BI and healthcare to ensure the company's BI capabilities are cutting-edge.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in a business intelligence role, preferably in the healthcare industry.
 * Proven experience with BI technologies, specifically PowerBI.
 * Strong knowledge of SQL, SSRS, ETL, Data Stores, and API.
 * Experience in data warehouse design and data mining.
 * Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution, etc.)
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
 * Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations related to data privacy and management.
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
   
   

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business results and have a proven track record in business intelligence, we would love to hear from you. Join us and help shape the future of our organization with your expertise.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Department Information

The Employment Development Department (EDD) is one of the largest State departments with employees at hundreds of service locations. For more than 70 years, the EDD has connected millions of job seekers and employers in an effort to build the economy of the Golden State. In order to continue our mission, we are constantly looking for the best and the brightest to join our ranks. Working at EDD presents many opportunities. If you strive to make a difference, we invite you to seek a career with EDD.

THIS POSITION MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR A HYBRID WORK SCHEDULE. THE AMOUNT OF TELEWORK IS AT THE DISCRETION OF THE DEPARTMENT AND IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE AS BUSINESS NEEDS ARISE.

Research Data Analyst I

The Research Data Analyst I will provide streamlined communication and coordination division-wide to fulfill Labor Market Information Division (LMID) customers requests for products and services. Assist with the development and implementation of statewide and regional labor market products and services in support of EDD programs, the Governor's office, the Labor and Workforce Development Agency, the California Workforce Development Board and local boards throughout the state, workforce development and economic development entities, researchers, and the public. Assist with studies related to Labor Market Information and emerging trends.

Research Data Analyst II

The Research Data Analyst II performs a variety of complex research assignments. Coordinate branch-wide with the development and implementation of statewide and regional labor market products and services in support of EDD programs, the Governor's office, the Labor and Workforce Development Agency, the California Workforce Development Board and local boards throughout the state, workforce development and economic development entities, researchers, and the public. Coordinate studies related to Labor Market Information and emerging trends.

This position is headquartered in Sacramento and may be eligible for telework under EDD's telework policy. California Government Code Section 14200 requires employees to reside in California to telecommute. Employees are required to report to their headquarters office, as needed. Travel expenses to and from the assigned headquarters are the responsibility of the employee.

title: RESEARCH DATA ANALYST I

description:
Job Description:

The Staff level Technical Data Analyst Radiology Imaging Services position is focused on generating impactful solutions for customers within a defined clinical or business area. The Staff level analyst works within a team and serves as the primary analyst supporting management level leadership within Radiology/Imaging Services. Analyst meets regularly with customer stakeholders to provide work updates, set project priorities and establish deliverable timelines. They partner with stakeholders to ensure the integrity and accuracy of customer data. They drive information insights through data exploration, interpretation, report development and visual storytelling. They are a member of the Clinical Shared Services analytics team, comprised of professionals working together to develop technical products focused on enabling Intermountain strategic initiatives and operational targets.

This position is part of a highly skilled, high impact team with deep clinical and technical expertise in leveraging healthcare data to solve real-world problems. Our teams report to analytics leaders and work in strong partnership with key business and clinical leaders across all areas of Intermountain Healthcare. This team provides ongoing training, maintenance, monitoring and promotion of data applications and reports to ensure data insights are widely known, accessible, and used to its fullest potential. This position helps develop and deploy world class data analytics at Intermountain Healthcare, one of the nation’s leading health systems. Data Analysts will partner with business and clinical leaders, and data professionals across the organization, supporting our Mission to help people live the healthiest lives possible.

In Brief, the Staff level Technical Data Analyst will gain a solid understanding of the data and operations of radiology/imaging services and partner with analytic leadership to ensure customer priorities are understood and resourced. Provide a high level of expertise and customer service in order to delight business and clinical customers through innovative and impactful analytic deliverables. Seek opportunities for intra/inter team collaboration to enhance analytic services. Contribute technical acumen and creative thinking to the success of your Agile Delivery Team and work to advance technical professional skills though structured and personal learning opportunities.

Minimum Qualifications

Must meet one of the following:

Bachelor's degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics with two years of relevant work experience in a role performing data analysis.

Or

Bachelor’s degree in another area of study with four years of relevant work experience in a role performing data analysis.

Experience without a related degree will be considered if skill set and experience are robust.

Plus:

Demonstration of these skills:

Intermediate SQL ability, knowledge of database design, data modeling and standardized data structures

Experience creating visually appealing, content rich and consumer centric reports and dashboards (i.e. Tableau, Cognos)

Proficiency in using word processing, spreadsheet, internet, e-mail, and scheduling applications

Highly effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

Ability to acquire Subject matter expertise in healthcare or related data (Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Compliance, Quality, Revenue Cycle, Strategic Planning, Population Health, etc.).

Lifelong learner with a creative, collaborative approach.

Temperament to thrive in scaled agile teams (SAFe®) or similar product management practice

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics. Experience with healthcare data, with radiology/imaging data experience strongly preferred. Experience with Epic, Azure Databricks, and ServiceNow.

Physical Requirements:

Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information.

- and -

Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands.

- and -

See and read computer monitors and documents

- and -

Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.

title: Data Analyst Technical Staff

description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst I is charged with analyzing the damage identification and offer strength performance of CAI Offers Businesses (PSX, PSDO, KBB ICO) to create and/or generate an adjusted offering via the Offer Intelligence platform. Offer Intelligence takes the statistically accurate market value of a vehicle and overlays competitive offers using real-time market condition value adjustments and historic value impacts to create unique offers aligned to each businesses go-to-market strategy. This role will be a critical contributor to the success of the Consumer Disposal project within KBB by maximizing Offer strength while minimizing risk to CAI.

This role will report to the Strategic Planning Sr. Director of Consumer Solutions but dotted line to the Director, Valuations Operations in Inventory Solutions and will work extensively across Consumer Solutions, CADS (Cox Automotive Data Science), and Inventory Solutions. Responsibilities include tracking valuations and offers, building known vehicle damage to valuation adjustment tables, building predictive damage tables, consulting with CADS on areas of algorithmic improvement, and consulting with Consumer Solutions Offers Businesses (KBB ICO, PSDO, PSX) on offer strength strategy.

Responsibilities:


 * Gather and analyze offers, across businesses, for accuracy, damage adjustment accuracy, and vehicle sale outcomes.
 * Mine vehicle databases, and assist in building a model that predicts vehicles damage at the YMMT (vehicle year, make, model, and trim) level
 * Understand the CADS roadmap and serve as a liaison with the Offers Business product teams to prioritize new valuation algorithm efforts.
 * Travel: 5%
   
   

Minimum Qualifications:


 * Bachelor's degree in a related discipline. The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as 4 years experience in a related field
 * Require strong knowledge of data analysis.
 * Knowledge, experience, and competency in SQL required.
 * Experience with Data Visualization tools and data storytelling (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required. Ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet deadlines required.
 * Comfortable with explanations and presentations of results from data analysis.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills required.
 * Strong time/task management skills required.
 * Candidates must demonstrate initiative with a results orientation, while exhibiting both a strong individual drive and ability to act jointly within a team.
 * Candidates must be able to embrace gaps in rules/processes, solve problems, and think strategically or outside the box when directives are vague or data is incomplete.
 * Data modeling and/or predictive trending
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:


 * BA/BS degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science or related field.
 * Data Querying in Python/R preferred
   
   

USD 53,200.00 - 79,800.00 per year

Compensation:

Compensation includes a base salary of $53,200.00 - $79,800.00. The base salary may vary within the anticipated base pay range based on factors such as the ultimate location of the position and the selected candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities. Position may be eligible for additional compensation that may include an incentive program.

Benefits:

The Company offers eligible employees the flexibility to take as much vacation with pay as they deem consistent with their duties, the company's needs, and its obligations; seven paid holidays throughout the calendar year; and up to 160 hours of paid wellness annually for their own wellness or that of family members. Employees are also eligible for additional paid time off in the form of bereavement leave, time off to vote, jury duty leave, volunteer time off, military leave, parental leave, and COVID-19 vaccination leave.

Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States for any employer without current or future sponsorship.
