title: Intelligence Analyst

description:
Company Description

About Adtalem Global Education

Adtalem Global Education is a national leader in post-secondary education and leading provider of professional talent to the healthcare industry. Adtalem educates and empowers students with the knowledge and skills to become leaders in their communities and make a lasting impact on public health, well-being and beyond. Through equitable access to education, environments that nurture student success, and a focus on expanding and diversifying the talent pipeline in healthcare, Adtalem is building a brighter future for communities and the world.

Adtalem is the parent organization of American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Chamberlain University, Ross University School of Medicine, Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine and Walden University.

Visit Adtalem.com for more information, and follow on Twitter and LinkedIn.

Adtalem believes in a culture of collaboration, creativity, and innovation, which thrives when we can work flexibly. Depending on your location, this role may be hybrid or remote.


 * HYBRID – In office in either Columbia, MD or Minneapolis, MN, or Chicago, IL (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thur.). Friday spent working from home.
   
   

Job Description

Opportunity at a Glance

The Business Systems Analyst delivers reporting with business/operational insights (i.e., business intelligence) and/or provides business system capability that ensures ISS provides exceptional services to ATGE. Leverages resources to provide ISS colleagues and stakeholders with data, information and insight presented in a way that enables informed decision making. The Analyst, builds, maintains, and improves ISS business systems and/or analytical tools. Collaborates with internal and ATGE stakeholders including IT/Product Development and institutions, and delivers on work projects to ensure compliance, efficiency and effective delivery of ISS business systems and analytical tools.

Responsibilities


 * Possesses high level of understanding of business areas and/or functions necessary to successfully undertake technical analysis, design, construction and implementation of system and data analytics which supports success of ISS, ATGE and multiple institutions.
 * Supports ISS and multiple institutions, potentially leveraging independent systems and data sources.
 * Collaborates with stakeholders to make systems and/or analytics/data tools adaptable for efficient and effective stakeholder interactions, decision making and processing functionality.
 * Creates project / process plans, reports, dashboards, and updates that clearly and intuitively conveys key information to stakeholders for the purpose of supporting quality business decisions.
 * Perform annual and ad hoc modifications into systems, reports and dashboards to maximize effectiveness.
 * Supports compliance with Federal, State and Institutional regulations.
 * Performs testing of solutions against design and business requirements to ensure a quality result which delivers upon targets and expectations.
 * Develops and documents User Acceptance Testing processes and adheres to Process Change Controls required by Internal Audit.
 * Reviews, identifies, and recommends technology and/or data enhancements to resolve issues, support maintenance and improve existing processes and tools.
 * Develop and maintain accurate documentation to capture and communicate business requirements, process design, and procedures which clearly communicate with key stakeholders (i.e. IT/Product Management, system vendors and all ATGE/institutions), and provides for training and business continuity.
 * Need to understand system design impacts on processing, reporting and analytics
 * Is responsive and reports status of all projects and issue resolution to appropriate stakeholders and ISS Leadership. Provides proactive updates until through completion/resolution.
 * Performs other duties as assigned.
 * Complies with all policies and standards.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's Degree Technology, Business, Analytics, and/or Education.
 * Experience working with Banner.
 * Thorough understanding of the business process and systems / analytical tools which will be leveraged in this role.
 * Working with applicable financial aid systems (may include Banner, ProSAM, PowerFaids, etc…).
 * Experience developing solutions through review of existing processes / reporting / configuration, incorporating business requirements, design, configuration / build, and user acceptance testing.
 * Experience working in multiple Information Technology environments.
 * Technical skills in understanding SQL queries and Unix/Linux commands.
 * Analytical report writing skills using Excel and Power BI.
 * Proficient with understanding and analyzing business needs, designing solutions based on needs, and articulating business impacts.
 * Detailed and process oriented with demonstrated capabilities in business process design, modeling and requirements analysis; ability to translate into detailed system requirements and/or analytics/reporting specifications.
 * Familiarity with Business Process Management (BPM) methodology (is a plus) and desire experience working with tools/technologies required to facilitate process modeling and documentation.
 * Displays excellent written and verbal communication skills with colleagues at all levels.
 * Excellent collaboration, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
 * Exceptional organization, problem solving, and analytical skills.
   
   

Additional Information

In support of the pay transparency laws enacted across the country, the expected salary range for this position is between $42661.58 and $75065.24. Actual pay will be adjusted based on job-related factors permitted by law, such as experience and training; geographic location; licensure and certifications; market factors; departmental budgets; and responsibility. Our Talent Acquisition Team will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements. The position qualifies for the below benefits.

Adtalem Offers a Robust Suite Of Benefits Including


 * Health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
 * 401k Retirement Program + 6% employer match
 * Participation in Adtalem’s Flexible Time Off (FTO) Policy
 * 12 Paid Holidays
   
   

For more information related to our benefits please visit: https://careers.adtalem.com/benefits.

description:

Description

We are offering a contract for a Data Analyst - Material in the agriculture industry, based in LOVELAND, Colorado. In this role, you will be involved in various tasks related to data management and analytics, with a focus on materials. You will be working directly in SAP on new and existing material data requests and other assigned projects.

Responsibilities


 * Troubleshoot and resolve any concerns regarding data requests
 * Work on various mini projects aimed at data cleanup or standardization
 * Manage data request trackers and provide updates to management
 * Use strong Excel skills to handle large or complicated data sets
 * Collaborate with team members to ensure effective operations
 * Communicate effectively with various stakeholders
 * Leverage your skills in data management and analytics to drive decision making
 * Use your understanding of materials handling to work on relevant projects
 * Work directly in SAP S/4HANA on new and existing material data requests
 * Carry out other duties as assigned by leadership.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required for handling and analyzing data.
 * Extensive knowledge of operations and analytics within the agriculture industry.
 * Experience in materials handling, ensuring efficiency and safety in operations.
 * Familiarity with 'About Time' software for effective time tracking and management.
 * Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to lead a team and make informed decisions.
 * Proven ability to troubleshoot issues and implement effective solutions.
 * Experience in the retail sector, particularly in relation to agricultural products, is preferred.
 * Strong data management skills, with the ability to organize, analyze and interpret large data sets.
 * Excellent communication skills for effective team collaboration and presentation of findings.
 * Ability to prepare datasets for analysis and interpretation.
 * Knowledge of Mindset Software for data analysis and reporting is an advantage.
 * Proficient in using 'Views' and 'Trackers' for monitoring and tracking operations.
 * Understanding of Nitrogen usage in agriculture, its impact, and management.
 * Experience with SAP S/4HANA for business process management and operations.
 * Expertise in QA Management to ensure quality standards and regulations are met.

title: Data Analyst - Material

description:
The Azure Storage team delivers a range of storage solutions—including Azure Blob Storage for object storage, Azure Files for shared storage, and Azure Disks for block storage—that empower developers to create scalable, durable, and highly available cloud-native and AI applications. We are one of the key growth engines for Azure.

We are seeking a Business Analyst - Azure Storage in the Data Science and Analytics team. This individual will leverage data, build and validate hypothesis, and provide recommendations to Storage Leadership in how we serve our customers better, identify new business opportunities, determine optimal pricing structures, and identify cost saving opportunities. Your recommendations will help investments with direct impact to Azure Storage Business.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our employees embrace a growth mindset, collaborate to achieve shared goals, and innovate to empower others. We build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to foster a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive.

Responsibilities


 * As you develop an understanding of the business across multiple areas, you’ll anticipate business problems. You’ll also use appropriate data to address business needs, identifying and taking steps to solve data issues and gaps.
 * You will determine appropriate analytical tools and techniques, then execute analyses and make actionable recommendations. You’ll also critically evaluate assumptions about data and analysis methods, and provide feedback on analytical tools.
 * You will develop presentations using dashboards, reports, data visualizations, and more to tell stories of analyses. As you do so, you’ll ensure presentations provide information accurately, clearly, and appropriately.
 * You will determine the factors and/or data types to include in evaluations, accounting for risks. You’ll analyze and report results, and identify relevant recommendations and/or connections to other work.
 * By working across teams, you’ll deepen expertise in data sources, methodologies, tools, and processes. You’ll then recommend efficiency improvements to core analytical and reporting work, and evaluate the viability of automated reporting and analysis methods.
   
   

Qualifications

Required Qualification:


 * Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 2+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
    * OR Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field
    * OR equivalent experience

 * 2+ years of experience with large scale distributed systems.
 * 2+ years of experience building dashboards, writing queries and analyzing structured and unstructured data.
 * 2+ years of experience in presenting and communicating with Executive Leadership.
   

Other Requirements


 * Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
   
   

Additional/Preferred Qualifications


 * Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 3+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
    * OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 1+ year(s) experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
    * OR equivalent experience.
      

Business Analytics IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $83,400 - $167,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $108,900 - $183,000 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft will accept applications for the role until January 17, 2025

#Azurecorejobs

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

description:
Varo is on a mission to redefine banking so it's easy for everyone to make smart choices with their money. Our app offers bank accounts and high-yield savings accounts that don’t cost a thing, tools to help you manage your money and save automatically, and invitation-only personal loans at competitive rates. On the contrary, traditional banks charge fees, offer next-to-nothing savings rates, and don’t work with their customer’s best interests in mind.



Varo is distinct from other fintechs: With preliminary approval for a bank charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), we're on our way to becoming the first mobile-centric national bank in the country. Our unique team combines the best people in tech and banking, and we’re wildly passionate about keeping our customers happy by helping them manage and grow their money. Based in San Francisco and privately held, Varo has raised $144M to date, led by Warburg Pincus and The Rise Fund / TPG Growth.



The Business Systems Analyst (IAM) position is a very important role in our Information Technology team at Varo and will report to Sr. Manager of Information Technology. This role will be responsible for identity & access management (IAM) framework, development,  certification and maintenance functions.






What you'll be doing
 * Develop\update the required IAM governance, certification program to support business and information security requirements for Varo Money and Varo Bank environments
 * Assess current state and develop future state IAM maturity model covering a broad range of topics including digital identities of workforce as well as scaling for growing customer\partner base that will meet\exceed regulatory expectations
 * Collaborate\partner with cross functional teams in all business units and stakeholders to identify\recommend\test IAM, Privileged Access Management (PAM), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) technologies, and processes as needed
 * Ensure strong authentication, authorization, role based access controls (RBAC) are implemented in existing\new applications\products, including mobile devices and physical access
 * Utilize IAM, PAM solutions and\or other processes in developing reporting identity & access governance certification metrics, dashboards
 * Assist the Sr. Manager of Information Technology in management of all other IT program areas, and functions, including Helpdesk support
 * Support data governance and data classification programs 
 * Assist with office-related IT tasks in San Francisco HQ in a hybrid working environment
   




You'll bring the following required skills and experiences
 * 7 - 10 years of information technology experience with specialization in IAM.  Related experience working in a financial institution, a fintech company, or a provider to the financial services business sector is preferred
 * Reporting on IAM\PAM governance & certification program; expert knowledge of IAM framework, and Risk Management Framework
 * Strong experience working with Okta, specifically Okta Identity Governance, and extensive knowledge of creating and maintaining Okta Workflows
 * B.S. in Cyber Security or Computer Science, Information Systems related majors
 * Security certifications (e.g. CISSP-ISSMP, CISM, CGEIT, CCSP and\or other comparable certifications in IAM domain) are a plus
 * Excellent IAM\PAM\RBAC\CASB\Single Sign On\Multi Factor Authentication\Federation\AWS IAM knowledge and experience
 * Extensive experience working with regulatory banking examiners to demonstrate higher level maturity in IAM governance & certification that meets mandatory requirements
 * Experience reporting\presenting to the senior management, the Board, and/or Committees of the Board on the status of IAM\PAM governance, certification efforts
   







#MidSenior



For cash compensation, we set standard ranges for all US-based roles based on function, level, and geographic location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Per applicable law, the salary range for this role is $100,000 - $120,000. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors as well as candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the identified range.
title: Business Systems Analyst, IAM

description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Implementation Analyst with over 8 years of relevant experience to join our team. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in business analysis, technical documentation, and SQL proficiency. While knowledge of CRIMS or post-trade workflows is beneficial, it is not essential. This role involves managing technical tasks, understanding business functions, and supporting various investment management and private market activities.

Key Responsibilities

· Identify, review, and implement control checks to enhance process efficiency and accuracy across various practice areas.

· Conduct comprehensive testing and validation of control checks to ensure alignment with business requirements and technical specifications.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into effective control measures.

· Maintain detailed documentation of control check processes, outcomes, and improvements.

· Conduct thorough business analysis to support project requirements.

· Familiarity with CRIMS or post-trade workflows is advantageous.

· Identify opportunities for process enhancements and lead initiatives to optimize control checks.

· Provide technical support and guidance to ensure successful implementation and operation of control checks.

· Proficient in SQL for data analysis and manipulation, deployment using GitHub or other source control, and building environments.

· Design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines to automate code integration, testing, and deployment for efficient and reliable software delivery.

· Strong knowledge of UNIX systems for effective management, scripting, and troubleshooting in a software development environment.

· Proficient in using JIRA and Confluence for efficient project management, collaboration, and documentation.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective collaboration and documentation.

· Basic understanding of capital markets, including trade, corporate actions, and post-trade activities.

· Experience in Investment Management and Private Markets, covering Portfolio Management, Trading and OEMS, Middle Office, Compliance, Asset and Valuation Management, and Deal Management.

· Candidates should be proactive, flexible, and able to take ownership.

· Relevant experience in business analysis, technical documentation, or a related field.

· Experience in testing various financial and accounting applications throughout all stages of the trading life cycle, from trade initiation to execution and settlement/record-keeping.

· Skilled in designing and implementing ETL processes for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading across various data sources.

· Proficiency in data management and analysis tools.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

· A bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, or a related field is preferred.

· Experience using source control systems to check-in/check-out configuration artifacts

Required Skills

· Strong expertise in investment banking, capital markets - Front, Middle and Back office operations

· Strong business analysis and problem-solving abilities

· Good to have Knowledge in snowflake

· Good knowledge in SQL to perform the work for BA

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

· Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment

· Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality work

· Capable of working both independently and as part of a team

· Proactive and solution-oriented mindset
sector: Investment Management, Capital Markets, and Software Development
title: Implementation Analyst

description:
This position is remote, work-from-home, and can be based anywhere within the United States.





What Data Analytics contributes to Cardinal Health



Data Analytics is responsible for applying business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant, and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives. Support Medical supply chain and logistics businesses by developing, managing, and maintaining data-driven tools and actionable insights.



Responsabilities

 * The role will work across the supply chain with different levels of the organization, gathering data and analytics requirements, driving data acquisition, ingestion & curation to deliver trusted actionable results in a clear and concise manner.
 * The role will also manage existing tools, such as scorecards and dashboards, and look for ways to enhance or improve upon speed, process flow, functionality, and overall value.
 * Uses knowledge of business and data to discover and/or anticipate problems or opportunities where data can be leveraged to address the need.
 * Asks probing questions to translate business needs in order to build and design reporting solutions (metric management, dashboards, enterprise performance management).
 * Applies data visualization, descriptive and summary statistical techniques for discovery and timely insights (data exploration, ad-hoc queries, and analysis).
 * Interprets results of analyses, identifies trends and issues (forecasting), and develops alternatives to support business objectives.
 * Applies data aggregation, descriptive analysis and data presentation techniques and tools to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action.
 * Demonstrates ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex information to a variety of audiences and mediums.
 * Prioritizes and organizes tasks to deliver on time
 * Clearly articulates progress updates, highlights risks with mitigation plans early and manages issues effectively



Qualifications

 * Bachelors Degree in related field, or equivalent work experience preferred
 * 4+ years experience in related field preferred
 * Experience with data query, visualization, dashboard and/or scorecard tools preferred
 * Ability to collect, synthesize, and interpret information from multiple sources as well as provide easy to understand recommendations
 * Strong mathematical and statistical skills
 * Prefer experience in Data Movement and Processing Technologies and Cloud Data Warehouse technologies including but not limited to experience with GCP, Big Query, Google Cloud Storage, Apache Spark
 * Strong knowledge and experience with Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, SAP, GCP/Big Query, and Python/R is preferred.
 * Distribution/Supply Chain experience a plus
 * Ability to travel up to 10% of the time domestically



What is expected of you and others at this level

 * Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
 * May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
 * Works on complex projects of large scope
 * Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
 * Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
 * Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
 * May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues



Anticipated salary range: $79,700 - $113,800

Bonus eligible: No

Benefits: Cardinal Health offers a wide variety of benefits and programs to support health and well-being.

 * Medical, dental and vision coverage
 * Paid time off plan
 * Health savings account (HSA)
 * 401k savings plan
 * Access to wages before pay day with myFlexPay
 * Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
 * Short- and long-term disability coverage
 * Work-Life resources
 * Paid parental leave
 * Healthy lifestyle programs

Application window anticipated to close: 1/20/2025 *if interested in opportunity, please submit application as soon as possible.

The salary range listed is an estimate. Pay at Cardinal Health is determined by multiple factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographical location, relevant education, experience and skills and an evaluation of internal pay equity.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.



Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.
